loans.name: Oishabibi

texts.en:
Oishabibi is a hardworking, married woman born in small town. She has one child and teaches in secondary school.Students are satisfied with her classes and  try  not to miss them. She provides interactive and interesting classes and is well known among teachers. 

Her salary is not enough to meet every day  expenditures and she needs additional income. She plans to buy livestock and requests 3000 TJS  to open her own business. She hopes that KIVA project members would not regret her application. She is thankful  for your support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
This borrower lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all attend school. She is also looking after additional family members. She and her husband live in her own house with no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

She has been selling dry fish at the market for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She also does some farming and sells the farm produce in order to earn more income. Protecting her merchandise from thieves is one of the challenges that she faces. Her dream is to upgrade from retail to wholesale.

She joined MCDT because of its timely loans. She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Haghine

texts.en:
Heghine is from the town of Ijevan. She has sold clothing for many years and gets supplies from Yerevan and to sell  in her local town. 

She is very hardworking woman, and also works as a confectioner. 

Heghine needs to purchase  clothing to enlarge her business. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to people who do not qualify under traditional practices.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Mimbetsa

texts.en:
Mimbetsa is a single man. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 15,000 that he is requesting, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Mimbetsa decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, and all are attending school. She is also looking after her mother. She lives in her own house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utilities.

She has been selling green bananas at retail from the market for the last five years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX.500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to upgrade to being a supplier and to buy a vehicle for the business. 

Amina joined MCDT-SACCO because the organization serves women and their children.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and all go to school. She takes take care of one additional family member.

She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works six days a week.

Florence has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Iskender

texts.en:
Iskender is a 34-year-old married man. His wife is a housekeeper and they have one son. Iskender is a master car mechanic and works in a local auto service, repairing car engines. His auto service is located in an old garage where he has worked for two years. He prepared this place in order to service cars and earn money for his family. He is a very hard working man and works day and night in order to provide for his family. His monthly income is only 210 AZN.

Auto service is very spread-out kind of service in the capital of Azerbaijan--Baku--and is in high demand. Iskender wants to expand his small and starting business in order to earn more for his family and provide his son with a good education and a happy life in the future. He applied for 1,100 AZN loan in order to provide his service place with water to facilitate cleaner working conditions. He also wants to buy new and quality tools for repairing engines, to make his service better. He hopes that this loan will help him to reach his goals and provide for his family.

loans.use: to provide his service place with water and to buy new quality repairing tools

loans.name: Nedia

texts.en:
Nedia is 57 years old, married, and has four children.

Nedia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nedia has been in this business for 29 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cuarentitres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras, de la etnia miskita. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, apoyar con los gastos del hogar y contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, se unieron hace 9 meses: María tiene una carnicería, Maila y Delena venden bastimentos en el mercado Bruno Gabriel, para acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria y tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus inventarios y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
María: Es una mujer cordial, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario 43, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 38 años de edad, casada con cinco hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Desde hace 15 años es comerciante, aun  recuerda con gran alegría que inicio vendiendo en un termo con hielo de manera ambulante carne de res y cerdo, gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por Pana Pana y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido tener su propio local en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar carne de pollo, cerdo, res, carne molida y así incrementar sus ingresos.  Ella sueña con ampliar su local y diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is comprised of three striving woman of Miskito ethnicity.  Nine months ago, they united for the purposes of improving their quality of life, contributing to the household expense, and having their own source of income.  Maria owns a butcher’s shop, and Maila and Delena sell supplies at the Bruno Gabriel market in order to have access to joint guarantee financing, and have the opportunity to increase their inventories and improve their income.

Maria, a cordial woman from Puerto Cabezas, is the coordinator of “Grupo Solidario 43”.  She is 38 years old, and married with five children in primary school. She has been a merchant, for fifteen years, but with great joy she still remembers that she started out as a street vendor, selling beef and pork from a cooler.  She is thankful for the previous loans granted by Pana Pana and the Kiva lenders as they have allowed her to have her own stall at one of the Bilwi markets.  She is requesting the loan to purchase chicken, pork, and ground beef and, in this way, increase her income.  Her dream is to expand her stall and diversify her products.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, pork, and ground beef.

loans.name: Karani

texts.en:
Karani is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He faces the major challenge of customers taking a long time to pay him for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: Carmen desesperada ante la situación crítica en la que se encontraba por falta de recursos y su responsabilidad como madre cabeza de familia a raíz de su separación, decidió emprender su propio negocio ofreciendo perfumes, ropa, camisas, blusas y carnes frías, con ayuda de una amiga quien le suministro estos productos, ella pudo iniciar su vida como comerciante, en la actualidad ella tiene cinco años de estar dedicada a esta actividad con la que ha logrado mantener a sus hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad.  Su horario laborar está comprendido entre las 10 a.m. y 5 p.m. y su cadena de comercialización consiste es en visitas que ella les hace a sus clientes de lunes a sábado y ofrece crédito o contado de acuerdo a la preferencia de pago de sus clientes. Sus proveedores son los almacenes y distribuidoras, quienes han depositado su confianza en ella ofreciéndole crédito y en algunas ocasiones cancela de contado. En la actualidad su capital es insuficiente para atender sus pedidos, es por ello que en está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas corporales, también carnes frías y productos de panadería.  Esta inversión incrementará las ventas y con ello las utilidades, lo que es muy importante para el bienestar de Carmen y el de su familia.  Ella a futuro desea tener su propio almacén y continuar trabajando comprometida para adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen, desperate in front of the critical situation in which she finds herself because of lack of resources and her responsibility as a mother head-of-household due to her separation, decided to start her own business. She offers perfumes, clothing, shirts, blouses and cold meats, with the help of a friend who supplies her with these products, she was able to start her life as a merchant. Currently, she has been dedicated to this activity for five years, with which she's achieved maintaining her children, 16 and 9 years of age. Her work schedule is comprised between 10 AM and 5 PM and her sales chain consists of the visits that she makes to her customers from Monday to Saturday. She offers credit or cash, according to the payment preference of her customers. Her providers are the warehouses and distributors, who have deposited their confidence in her, offering her credit and, on some occasions, she pays in cash.

Currently, her capital is insufficient to tend to her orders. This is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan by way of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, perfumes, body creams, also cold meats and bakery products. This investment will increase the sales and with that the profits, which is very important for the wellbeing of Carmen and her family. In the future, she wishes to have her own warehouse and continue working diligently in order to acquire her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, body creams, also cold meats and bakery products.

loans.name: Sayemarys

texts.es: Sayemarys es una mujer de  35 años de edad, que encontró la manera de crecer comercialmente a través de empresas especializadas en ventas por catálogos, esta idea de negocio nació por la oportunidad que una amiga le ofreció de vender estos productos y la incorporó. Ella está dedicada a las ventas desde el año 2000 y ha logrado consolidar un gran  número de clientes que en su gran mayoría son amigos, vecinos, familiares y referidos, su cadena de comercialización es precisamente a través de la oferta por campañas de los catálogos que lleva a las casas u oficinas donde trabajan sus clientes, quienes realizan sus pedidos y los cancela en cuotas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en productos de tocador línea femenina como cosméticos, cremas corporales, fragancias, talcos y demás.  Esta inversión es importante para poder cumplir con la entrega de los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes, así mismo para lograr cumplir con su presupuesto de ventas.  Sayemarys es madre de dos hijos de 11 y 4 años a quienes desea continuar educando y ofreciendo bienestar, por ello labora comprometida por cumplir con su meta a largo plazo de crecer y adquirir un local comercial.
texts.en:
Sayemarys is a 35-year-old woman, who found a way to grow commercially through companies specialized in catalog sales. This business idea was born because of the opportunity that a friend gave her to sell this product, and she adopted it. She has worked in sales since the year 2000, and has managed to consolidate a great number of clients, mainly friends, neighbors, family members, and referrals. Her sales chain is precisely through the offer of campaigns from catalogs which she takes to the houses or offices where her clients work, who make the orders, and fulfill them with payments, 
Currently she is applying for her first credikiva through the foundation of Mario Santo Domingo to invest in bathroom products for women, such as cosmetics, body creams, fragrances, powders, and more. 
This investment is important to be able to meet the delivery of the requested products for her clients, and in this way achieve her sales budget. 
Sayemarys is the mother of two children, who are 11 and 4, whom she wishes to continue educating and offering well-being. This is why she works in such a committed way, to meet her long-term goal of growing and acquiring a sales establishment.

loans.use: to invest in dressing room products for women, such as cosmetics, body creams, fragrances, and powders.

loans.name: Lextion

texts.en: Lextion is a 30-year-old married man with three children. He runs a small business in Lui town. He has a retail shoe stall in the market near his home. He has requested a loan of 600 SSP to expand the business by buying more secondhand shoes for customers.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand shoes for customers.

loans.name: Hajati

texts.en: Hajati is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (older parents). She has a restaurant and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more food ingredients like bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, maize flour, sweet, and Irish potatoes. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, maize flour, and other ingredients

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is married with six children, and three of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for many years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice, cooking oil and bread.  

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked shop. 

Mastula resides in the family home where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice, cooking oil and bread.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She has additional family members. 

Margret sells old clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last two years. She gets additional income from tailoring. 

Margret has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 (Ugandan shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy a bale of used clothes. 

Her major challenge includes transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business. 

Margret lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity,but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, a youthful 44-year-old farmer from Wanguru, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Kerugoya area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Dickson has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. 

Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Dickson started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. His sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. The Kerugoya area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Dickson is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Dickson is very determined to succeed. Because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and for his grandchildren through accumulated profits. Dickson's dream is to provide a secure future for his grandchildren by paying tuition fees for them. You will help him realize his dream through your loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Adriana Paola

texts.es: Adriana es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de accesorios para celulares, recargas, electrodomésticos y ropa, su mamá se dedica a esta actividad y fue quien le enseñó el manejo de este negocio, Adriana poco a poco fue aprendiendo y hoy en día cuenta con una clientela fidelizada a quienes les ofrece su productos a crédito. Ella labora en el horario de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m. todos los días, realiza sus comprar según los encargos que tenga  y el stock de productos que considere se pueda vender desde su casa.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en electrodomésticos, accesorios para celular, recargas de minutos y ropa. Esta inversión es muy importante puesto que podrá cumplir oportunamente con sus pedidos. Adriana desea continuar estudiando para mejorar su calidad de vida y en su negocio se proyecta a futuro con un surtido más amplio y más clientes.
texts.en:
Adriana, 19, is an enterprising young woman who earns a living selling mobile phone accessories, recharge cards, electrical appliances, and clothing.  Her mother is in that line of work and she taught Adriana how to manage the business.  She learned little by little and now has loyal customers to whom she sells on credit.  She works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.  She makes her purchases based on her orders and the stock she thinks she can sell from home.

Currently Adriana's applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in appliances, phone accessories, recharge cards, and clothing.  This is a very important investment because she'll be able to fill her orders opportunely.

Adriana wants to keep on studying to improve her quality of life.  In her business she wants to have a wider variety of stock and more customers in the future.

loans.use: to invest in electrical appliances, mobile phone accessories, recharge cards, and clothing

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.es: Geraldin es una emprendedora joven de 18 años de edad, aprendió de su madre el arte de elaborar productos de repostería como cupcake, galletas, tortas y pastelitos de hojaldre, su mamá ha estado dedicada a esta actividad durante años y toda su experiencia le ha sido de gran apoyo. Alterno a ésta actividad Geraldin promueve la venta de productos por catálogos especializados en diferentes tipos de artículos de uso personal, que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares.  Su cadena de comercialización para los productos de repostería está enfocada hacia colegios, universidades y amigos del sector donde reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y que vende de contado por lo que su flujo de efectivo es muy dinámico, sin embargo su capital le es insuficiente por ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de materias primas como harinas, huevos, esencias y demás. Esta inversión dinamiza las ventas y con ello mitiga la falta de capital.  Geraldin desea continuar sus estudios universitarios y a futuro hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Geraldin is an entrepreneurial 18-year-old young woman.  She learned the art of preparing confectionery products such as cupcakes, cookies, cakes, and puff pastries from her mother.  Her mother has worked at this occupation for years and all of her experience has been a great support.  Alternating with this occupation, Geraldin promotes the sale of catalogue products specializing in different types of personal use articles that she offers to her friends and family.  

Her marketing network for the confectionery products is focused towards schools, universities and friends in the part of the municipality of Barranquilla where she lives.  She makes cash sales, so her cash flow is very dynamic.  However, her capital is insufficient and thus she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of “Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo” in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as flour, eggs, essences and so on. 

This investment will invigorate sales and thus alleviate the shortage of capital.  Geraldin wishes to continue her university studies and in the future to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, eggs, essences and so on

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
This group is called With God. It consists of three women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Teshie, Accra. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. 

They have applied for a loan of 3,000 GHS from Kiva through ID Ghana. They sell slippers, bedsheets and groceries. 

Gifty is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. She is the featured borrower of the group. Gifty lives with her family in a rented apartment. She attended elementary school but could not complete her studies because she got married very young. She is a very dynamic and vigorous woman. 

Gifty has to help her husband in taking care of the family. As a result, she is requesting a loan of GHS 1,500 from ID Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase bedsheets from the market and sell them to her customers door-to-door. 

She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale shop a few years from now with the help of Kiva through ID Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets from the market and sell them to her customers door-to-door.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana, who is a 63-year-old widow, is from the village of Tserovani. She has only one son, who works at a security service. He gets 300 GEL fixed salary, which is the only source of income for this family. Liana doesn't have any business activity for herself, but she has a great desire to start an agribusiness, a profitable source of income in her region. Liana lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Liana to get a loan of 2,000 GEL and start dairy farming. She will purchase a milk cow, breed it, and produce dairy products for her family and to sell. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Liana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman and has one kid who does not attend school. Together with her husband and kid they live at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sarah has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are both ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 34-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and 3 children in the Rustavi district. Leila works as nurse at a local kindergarten and gets a small monthly income. Her husband is a driver. 

Leila requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit Leila wants to trade in mushrooms and increase the family income. With an increased income Leila will be able to improve the living conditions for her 3 children.

loans.use: to begin trading in mushrooms.

loans.name: Marjorie Lucia

texts.es: Marjorie es habitante en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, tiene 24 años de edad y es madre de una niña de 1 año, inició su negocio con la ayuda y experiencia de su cónyuge quien luego de haber sido retirado de su empleo, aportó unos ahorros como capital inicial para el negocio de venta y cría de cerdos y pollos.  Marjorie ha obtenido los resultados esperados, ha logrado mantenerse tras un año de funcionamiento y sus principales clientes son restaurantes, tiendas de barrios, amigos y vecinos, quienes adquieren sus productos periódicamente para  su comercialización o consumo.  Estos productos de consumo masivo los ofrece con facilidad de pago, de acuerdo al flujo de caja de cada cliente. Marjorie está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de un enfriador para preservar las carnes y compra de animales para la cría.  Esta inversión impacta positivamente a la calidad del producto y a la productividad del negocio. Marjorie labora de 4 a.m. a 7 p.m. todos los días, ella es muy comprometida y responsable, considera que para lograr sus propositos y metas debe estar siempre en esa actitud. Ella desea a futuro tener un local propio y una casa para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marjorie lives in a neighborhood in Barranquilla.  She is 24 years old and is the mother of a one-year-old daughter. She started her business with the help and experience of her life partner, who after losing his job contributed some savings as start-up capital for the business of raising and selling pigs and chickens.  

Marjorie has gotten the results she hoped for -  she has managed to support herself after one year of operation. Her main clients are restaurants, neighborhood stores, friends and neighbors, who purchase her products periodically for their own use or to sell. She offers these consumer products with easy payment terms, depending on the cash flow of each client. 

Marjorie is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy a refrigerator for the meat and to buy animals to raise. This investment will have a positive impact on the quality of the product and the productivity of the business. Marjorie works from 4 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.  She is very committed and responsible and feels that in order to achieve her aims and goals she must always have this attitude.

In the future she hopes to have her own shop and a house to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for the meat, and to buy more animals to raise.

loans.name: Alawa

texts.en:
Alawa is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a widowed woman and has two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge with seasonality and because of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials like metal, anti corrosion agents and paints.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and a responsible person. He is very good in his interaction with customers in his general store. Running his store is a big responsibility.

A loan of 1,500 SSP will help him to buy more new goods, including sugar, soap, etc. to sell to the customers.

loans.use: to buy more new goods to sell to the customers.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angella lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is a single mother of four children, two in school. She has additional family members to support. She is a poultry farmer who operates her business from home. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for one year. Angella has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of poultry feed. Her major challenge is transportation. Her goal is to expand her poultry business. She owns a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married mother of seven adult children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Chizi operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Yuliana Paola

texts.es: Yuliana es una joven de 19 años de edad, habitante de un barrio en el sur occidente de Barranquilla, está dedicada a la venta de productos naturales y accesorios, desde muy niña siempre le apasionó vender artículos en su escuela, ella le ofrecía a sus compañeras dulces, golosinas y accesorios como hebillas para el cabello y detalles, de esta manera a temprana edad inició una vida como comerciante. Hoy en día además de continuar con la venta de accesorios, también ofrece productos naturales y sus ganancias las aporta a los gastos familiares puesto que su madre está separada.  Su cadena de comercialización consiste en visitar a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son sus amigos, les ofrece charlas sobre el beneficio del uso de los productos naturales y como aportan a su bienestar y salud, ella se dedica a esta actividad todos los días en el horario de 4 p.m. a 7 p.m.  Su capital es muy escaso para cumplir con la demanda de pedidos, sin embargo está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en accesorios, hebillas para el cabello y productos naturales.  Yuliana tiene como meta a futuro continuar con sus estudios y empezar la universidad para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yuliana is a 19 year old youth who lives in a neighborhood in the south-east of Barranquilla. She works selling natural products and accessories. Since she was a young girl she has loved selling things at her school. She offered sweets and accessories like hair barrettes to her school mates. Doing this she started her life as a businessperson at an early age.

Today besides continuing with her sales of accessories, she also offers natural products. Her profits go to help with the household expenses as her mother is separated. Her method of selling is to visit her clients who in the main part are her friends. She offers them talks about the benefits of using the natural products and how they add to their well-being and health. She works doing this every day from 4 pm until 7pm.

Her capital is too small to fulfill the requests for goods so she is applying for her first loan from KIva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in accessories, hair barrettes and natural products. Yuliana has the goal for the future of continuing with her studies and starting university to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in accessories, hair barrettes and natural products.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: This is Tamar's second loan with Kiva. She used the first loan to start a trading business which was profitable for her. Because of her family's unstable financial condition, she had to stop her business activity. Nowadays the family's only source of income is Tamar's son's job. He is a private artisan and earns approximately 300 GEL. They find it hard to cover even basic needs so the family lives in poverty and requires additional income. Tamar has a great desire to re-start her trading business and requested a loan for this purpose. Her loan request was approved within a start-up program. It is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables poor people to start or re-start businesses. She plans to purchase clothing to re-sell in her community. Tamar will get the chance to earn her own income and contribute to the family's welfare. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders who will finance her loan request.

loans.use: To re-start trading business with clothing

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is the father of three children and has a great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals. That is what fills Hassan with enthusiasm and inspiration. Hassan is 28 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, he aspires to offer all of his children a university education. Hassan learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to his parents. He has a tiny plot of land – just under half an acre –  to farm and has always struggled to support his family. Hassan has developed the farm in the sloping undulating terrain by successfully adopting soil and water conservation methods. For over five years, his income source has been from selling milk, poultry, and vegetables. He supplements the meager income by doing other personal business. Hassan passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding his own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. He is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in his village. Milk, poultry and vegetables are very perishable, and these products require timely delivery to the market. One problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Nyamira area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Hassan is kindly seeking a loan to buy another motorbike. Farmers like Hassan will use the motorbike to transport passengers and farm goods to and from the market. They are suited for areas with poor road networks  inaccessible by cars. They are also very cheap to acquire and maintain. Invest in Hassan’s future and you won't regret it. He is full of promise. So far, he has managed to send his children to standard private schools with his hard work.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Lisambra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Noemy Jovielka, Solmari y Cristina) de la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Lamlaya, que en lengua miskita significa agua mansa, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de: Pulpería y venta de verduras y bastimentos; se organizaron hace aproximadamente 2 años para tener acceso a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. El nombre del Grupo Solidario Lisambra, es del vocablo miskito que significa inundación, las integrantes del grupo se identifican con este nombre, porque para ellas se llenaran de prosperidad y mejora en su calidad de vida, de sus familias y negocios.   

Noemy Jovielka: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven alegre de 23 años de edad, soltera, con cualidades de líder. Desde hace 8 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y apoyar con sus hermanos menores con sus estudios de secundaria. Está solicitando financiamiento para incrementar su mercadería y comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, detergentes, pan, huevos, papel higiénico y así acrecentar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con llegar a tener una distribuidora.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women: Noemy Jovielka, Solmari, and Cristina. They belong to the Miskita ethnic group of the Lamlaya community in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. "Lamlaya" in the Miskita language means "peaceful water."

The members are enterprising women who strive every day to grow their small business, which are running a grocery store, selling vegetables, and selling supplies. About two years ago, they organized as a group to have access to loans with joint and several guarantee from Pana Pana. 

The name of the group, "Lisambra," is a Miskito word that means "flooding." The members of the group identify themselves with the group's name because for them it means that they will be "flooded" with prosperity and improvements in their businesses and in their quality of life and that of their families.

Noemy Jovielka is the group's coordinator. She is a cheerful 23-year old woman, who is single and has leadership skills. Eight years ago, she set up her small grocery store to help out with the household expenses and help support her younger siblings through high school.

She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory by buying basic grains, snacks, detergent, bread, eggs, and toilet paper. In this way, she will boost her income. 

She dreams of having a wholesale distribution business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by buying basic grains, snacks, detergent, bread, eggs, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 29-year-old married mother of two children. She lives in Mundri in the South Sudan region of Sudan.  A loan of 2,200 SSP helps her to pay for new clothing to keep up with customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of breeding animals, as well as sugar, milk, and fruits to make popsicles.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Asha earns a living by selling vegetables from a stall to neighbors and people who live in her town. Her main challenge is the high cost of transporting produce to her stall. In the future, she dreams of expanding her produce stand and establishing a motorcycle transport business. She has requested a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 38 лет, замужем, образование среднее. Чынара 20 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. В хозяйстве Чынары есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На ежедневной основе она продает молоко. Домашнее и экологически чистое оно пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Чынара намерена увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Chynara is 38 years old, married and has a secondary education. Chynara got involved in animal husbandry 20 years ago. Her farm contains 4 cows, 10 sheep and 2 horses. She sells milk on a daily basis. The ecologically-clean farm milk is in high demand and yields her a monthly profit of about 17,000 som (KGS). In order to increase her livestock headcount, Chynara requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls. Chynara intends to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Zhaina

texts.ru: Жайна, 51 год, вдова, есть сын. Образование среднее. 33 года назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 35 овец, 7 лошадей. Ежемесячная прибыль Жайны составляет около 23,000 сом (KGS). Этого безусловно не хватает на достойную жизнь Жайны и ее сына, поэтому она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник доходов. Жайна обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от бизнеса Жайна будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Zhaina is 51 years old, a widow and has one son. She has a secondary education. She got involved in agriculture - animal husbandry and farming - 33 years ago.  Her farm contains 8 cows, 35 sheep and 7 horses. Zhaina's monthly profit amounts to about 23,000 som (KGS). This is certainly not enough for a decent life for Zhaina and her son, and this is why she decided to grow her agricultural business, since this is her sole source of income. Zhaina requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls. Zhaina will invest the earnings from the business into further developing it in order to be able to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to grow her business and income

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is the jovial 43-year-old father of lovely children whom he refers to as his “heartbeat." He hails from the Litein area of Kenya, a place that has produced some top elite athletes and has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Benjamin is a very hardworking man who enjoys farming, which he has been doing on his small piece of land for the past 13 years. Through all those years, he has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in his village. Because of the immense knowledge that he has in farming, Benjamin offers extension services to other farmers who are new to the business. Being a caring and loving father, Benjamin has been able to take care of his family and support them by the profits he has earned from farming. Although he reaps much profit, one challenge that he is facing that is dragging him down and preventing him being more successful is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of KES 70,000 to buy a piece of land and expand his farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Benjamin is sure that he will make good use of the land and double his profit. This will allow him to repay the loan, improve his living conditions, and realize his dream of having a good quality life and securing his children's future. Benjamin has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as being honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are large-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Margaret will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as being business-oriented. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate capital. 

Charity will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to open more business branches within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is Charity's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Элнура, 33 года, замужем, мама 2 детей. У Элнуры среднее образование, она по характеру: отзывчивая, честная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Элнуры в хозяйстве имеется: 4 лошади, 20 овец. Ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Элнура в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Элнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, что позволит ей увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Elnura is 33 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. Elnura has a secondary education. She is responsive, honest and hardworking. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years, having started her business 15 years ago. Thanks to Elnura's hard work, today her farm contains 4 horses and 20 sheep. Her business yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Elnura decided to request a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls. Elnura plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further grow her business, which will allow her to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to grow her business

loans.name: Krobor Bukom Group

texts.en: Patience's group is beginning their ninth loan with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner. It is made up of three members who sell silver sets, plastic tables and chairs, underwear, plates and wine glasses. The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small businesses of the group of which Patience is a member. She tells us that she joined ID-Ghana barely nine months ago. She currently has a business selling silver sets, plastic tables and chairs. She started this business 21 years ago. Some time passed and she decided to open her business independently with a small amount of capital. The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital so she can purchase silver sets, plastic tables and chairs, in bulk. She will purchase silver sets, plastic tables and chairs from the market and will later distribute to customers. This type of work allows her to generate the resources that she needs to support her family. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the loans and the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase silver sets, plastic tables and chairs, from the market and will later sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 35-year-old young woman; she is mother of two minor children. They live alone and earn a living with the transfers from abroad. However they find it hard to cover all daily costs and that's why Maria wants to start her own activity. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and lack of experience. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.

Maria has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Maria will purchase stock of various clothing, will rent the place to the local market and start trading.

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Maria be able to create better living conditions for her children and generate her own income.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and start trading

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en: Gabriela is 34 years old and she has a baby daughter. Gabriela lives at her parent's house because she does not have a place to go. Gabriela works as receptionist and her job has very hard schedules. Gabriela needs a loan to fix the roof of her bedroom in her parent's house. Right now Gabriela is the only one at her house that is working so she needs your help.

loans.use: to fix her roof.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 43 years old, and lives with her 8-year-old daughter and her husband. They are very happy together. Mary sells clothes; she purchases her merchandise from Chile (usually they have good clothes there). Since school has started Mary requests a loan to buy clothes to sell as school uniforms (blue pants, blue sweaters, white shirts for example). She will do anything to improve her life quality. Mary needs to pay the rent right now so it is important that you could help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell as school uniforms (blue pants, blue sweaters, white shirts for example)

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle breakdown. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to open a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Aisada

texts.ru: Айсада 56 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, младшая дочь учится в медицинском училище. Айсада, в качестве основного дохода уже 14 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы и лошадь. На участке мерою 2,6 Га они выращивают фасоль для реализации. Дети и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Айсада обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Айсаде улучшить благосостояние семьи и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Aisada is 56 years old, married and a mother of 3 children, the youngest of whom attends a medical college. To provide the primary income, Aisada has been involved in animal husbandry for 14 years. Today she has 3 cows and a horse. She grows beans for sale on 2.6 hectares of land. Her children and husband help her with the business. Aisada requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a horse in order to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will allow Aisada to improve her family's welfare and further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a horse in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for resale

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is married and she has 3 children whose ages range from 4 to 12 years. She describes herself to be good. For the past 7 years, Monicah has operated a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows maize to sell. Her business is located in a populated area. Monicah will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of maize for resale. Her business goal is to be a major distributor of maize within 5 years. Monicah hopes to improve her living standards in the future. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be reliable and honest. For the past 8 years, John has operated a retail business where he sells veterinary products. His primary customers are farmers. John describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of veterinary products. John's business goal is to be a large scale supplier within 5 years. He hopes to own a large scale business in the future. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of veterinary products

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Morena is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their son. She has had a small store for some years, which is located in her home. She sells a variety of products, including sweets, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc. She has many clients because of her good prices. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale. Since this is her only source of income, this will allow her to have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: sweets, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is married and has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. For the past 3 years, Monicah has operated a retail business selling vegetables. Her business is located in an area with potential for business growth and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. Monicah will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make his home bigger and to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Edwin Eduardo

texts.es:
Edwin, de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está soltero, vive con su mamá, su hermano y una sobrina, todos ellos dependen económicamente de él.- A su mamá le van a realizar una operación en la vista.

Edwin, se dedica a la ganadería y sus derivados desde hace más de 25 años, este trabajo se lo enseño su padre, quien ya falleció.
Edwin, necesita el dinero para comprar pasto para sus vacas y comprar una vaca más, para mantener sus ingresos y no verse afectado en la temporada de verano.

El sueña con ver recuperada a su mamá y que pueda valerse por sí misma como antes lo hacía.- Además, sueña con tener una de las mejores ganaderías de la zona y tener ganado tecnificado y de las mejores razas con el financiamiento de préstamo y con la buena administración pretende ampliar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Edwin is 45 years old. He studied through eighth grade and is single. He lives with his mother, brother, and a niece. They all depend financially on him. His mother is going to have an operation soon.

Edwin has been dedicated to livestock and its byproducts for more than 25 years. He learned this work from his father, who has passed away.

Edwin needs the money to buy fodder for his cows and to buy another cow. This will help him maintain his income, so that he won’t be affected in the summer season.

His dream is to see his mother recovered and for her to be able to do everything in the same way she used to. Also, he dreams of having one of the best ranches in the area, of having good cattle, and of having the best breeds. With the money from the loan and with good management of the funds, he hopes to grow his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cows and to buy another cow.

loans.name: Immanuel

texts.en: Immanuel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for six years. Immanuel's business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Hellen's business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will take care of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells herbal medicine and eggs. She has been involved in this business for five years. Susan's business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of herbal medicine. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to prosper in business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools and wood in order to make some furniture that has been requested from him.

loans.name: Edna Zoila

texts.es: Edna, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Trinidad, Santa Bárbara. hace cinco años decidió por tener su propio negocio y empezó a elaborar tamales (hechos de harina de maíz rellenos con carne de pollo y cerdo, papas, arroz, alcaparras, aceitunas etc.)y vender. Las ventas las ha realizado de manera ambulante ofreciendo su producto de casa en casa. esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos como harina de maíz, condimentos, carnes, arroz, aceitunas, alcaparras, papas y otros materiales que necesita para hacer los tamales y con una parte del préstamo comprara sillas y mesas para establecer un negocio de comidas rápidas en su casa y obtener mejores ganancias para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Edna, 35, lives in a common law relationship with her partner with whom she has three children and resides in a village of the municipality of Trinidad, Santa Barbara.  Five years ago, she decided to have her own business and began to make tamales (made from corn meal filled with chicken and pork, potatoes, rice, capers, olives, etc.) which she sells.  She makes her sales itinerantly offering her products house to house.
She is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras with which she will buy supplies like corn meal, condiments, meats, rice, olives, capers, potatoes, and other materials she needs to make the tamales and with a part of the loan she will buy chairs and tables to establish a fast food business in her house so as to obtain better earnings in order for her children to be able to study and have a better level of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies (corn meal, condiments, meats, rice, olives, potatoes) in order to make tamales and to buy tables and chairs so she can sell fast food in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 32 años de edad, está soltera, tiene un hijo, ella solo estudió hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y su hijo estudia primer grado en una escuela nacional.

Ana, se dedica al trabajo de la ganadería y venta de tortillas desde hace cinco años.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz para la venta de tortillas y vitaminas para el ganado.

Como toda persona tiene un sueño y es el de construir o comprar su propia casa, de esta forma le estará asegurando una vivienda a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is single and has a son.  She only studied up to the ninth grade.  She is a single mother and her son studies in the first grade of a national school.
For five years, Ana has been making a living from raising livestock and selling tortillas.
Ana needs the loan in order to buy corn for the tortilla sales and vitamins for the cattle. 
Everybody has a dream and hers is to construct or buy her own house.  In this way, she will be assuring a residence for her son.

loans.use: to buy corn for the sale of tortillas and vitamins for the cattle.

loans.name: Cristian Ernesto

texts.es:
Cristian, de 28 años de edad, es empleado, está casado, estudió hasta bachillerato, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuida de su hijo de 15 meses de nacido.

Cristian, tiene 7 años de trabajar en una empresa de distribución de productos de primera necesidad, antes trabajaba como bodeguero en  la misma empresa, su horario es de 7:00 de la mañana a 4:30 de la tarde.

El préstamo lo utilizará para reparar el techo de su vivienda y para repellar las paredes, con este crédito solventará esa necesidad.

Cristian, en un futuro sueña con poner una tienda en su casa, para que su esposa la administre, mientras él trabaja.
texts.en:
Cristian is 28 years old. He is employed and married, and he studied through high school. His wife performs household chores and takes care of their 15-month-old baby.

For the past 7 years, Cristian has worked for a business that distributes staple products. Previously, he worked as a grocer for the same business. He works from 7:00 am until 4:30 pm. 

He is requesting a loan to repair the roof of his house and to plaster the walls. With this loan, he will cover the costs of this necessity. Cristian dreams of opening a store in his house in the future, which his wife will manage while he works.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house and to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 64 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hija mujer de 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, constante, emprendedora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal de verduras y frutas provenientes del norte de la ciudad y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del mismo lugar, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Cristina es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que esta empezando a estudiar en la universidad, la familia vive en una casa propia de una habitación, cuenta con agua potable, alcantarillado, gas domiciliario y luz eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y gaseosas, su principal público son los viajantes que esperan su bus o que retornan de viaje debido a las paradas de buses interprovincial que existen en el lugar. “para vender debo ir detrás de los buses que viajan a yungas, con mi edad es bastante cansador…” comenta. Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de un mostrador para exponer las gaseosas y para incrementar sus ingresos y ayudar a pagar los gastos universitarios de su hija. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 21 años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mostrador de gaseosas para incrementar sus ventas y ayudar con los gastos universitarios de su hija.
texts.en:
Cristina, 64, is single, has a 19-year-old daughter, and her business is the sale of drinks.
She is a good mother, responsible, constant, enterprising, and hard-working.  Her business is in the Villa Fatima zone, a place characterized by the informal trade in vegetables and fruits from the north of the city and near the public transportation stops with departures to towns of the same place with a cold and windy climate, winds that come from the cordillera at an altitude of 3600 meters above sea level.
Cristina is dark-complected, of short stature, has black hair with long locks, and dresses in traditional fashion (hat, shawl, and skirt).  Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish with the general population and in her work.  She shares her life with her daughter who is starting to study in the university.  The family lives in a house of a lodging which has running water, sewer system, domestic gas, and electricity.
Her business is the sales of drinks and soft drinks.  Her principal customers are travelers awaiting their buses or returning from a journey since there are interprovincial bus stops in the area.  "In order to sell, I have to go behind the buses heading for the jungle which at my age is very tiring," she says.  Her dream is to fortify her business.  She wishes to expand her business by buying a display in order to show off her soft drinks and in order to increase her income and help pay the university expenses of her daughter.  This is the third sequence of loans with the institution in 21 years that she has requested.
For these motives, Cristina is requesting a loan in order to buy a display for soft drinks in order to increase her sales and help with the university expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a display for soft drinks in order to increase her sales and help with the university expenses of her daughter.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her mid 30s, is married with four children who are still at school.  She has been running two projects, tailoring and selling charcoal, for 15 years now.  She works from 07am to 08pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Pili's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a sewing machine, started selling charcoal, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  

She is happy with the loan, and appreciates Kiva for supporting her.  She used the profit to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dresses, suits, for making bedsheets, and to buy sacks of  charcoal

loans.name: Mery Areli

texts.es:
Mery, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de un hijo va a la escuela, es empelada desde hace cinco años en una empresa de servicio.

Mery, necesita el dinero para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes y veneno; sueña con que su hijo tenga buena educación y se gradué siendo un profesional de éxito.
texts.en: Mery is 27 years old. She studied through high school. She is a single mom of a boy who goes to school. She has been an employee for the past five years of a service company. Mery needs the loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers and poison. She dreams that her child gets a good education and that he will graduate to become a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy manure, seeds, fertilizers and poison.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina has a grocery store in her neighborhood. She is the mother of six kids and she has her own house. Her husband is a mason and he also drives a taxi. Marcelina needs a loan to buy more groceries, such as soft drinks, bread, cookies, etc. for her store. There are only three stores in Marcelina's neighborhood so she has a chance to earn more money. She hopes you can help her because she would like to have a mini market one day.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 20 years old and she has a baby daughter. Ana sells food and she paints tablecloths and other things that people use at the table (glasses for instance; she paints glasses too). She learned to paint some years ago. Ana is completely alone and she doesnt have anyone to help her. That is why she needs your support.  Ana is a single mother and she will do anything to help her daughter.  Ana needs a loan to buy paint, cloth and glassware.

loans.use: to buy paint, cloth, and glassware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the floor in his home and build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Rosa  Elvira

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Rosa, una señora de 44 años, quien tiene dos hijos, ambos pequeños estudian.
Rosa comenta que ella empezó con su negocio hace 24 años con tres máquinas de coser, esta feliz porque esta  profesión siempre le ha gustado y  gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y darles la educación a sus hijos. Rosa ahora ya como microempresaria a podido dar trabajo a una señora ya que sola no alcanza con tanto trabajo, su negocio tiene buena clientela por la clase de trabajos que ella realiza. 
 Rosa acude por primera vez a Fundación Alternativa y se siente muy feliz porque con este crédito ella podrá invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de uniformes escolares ya que se acerca la temporada de alta demanda porque en estos meses está por iniciar el año escolar.
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados is a city on the coast which is known in Ecuador for being a productive and commercial zone. Precisely in that city there is a lot of commercial trade, as it is the ground port linking the mountains and the coast. This is where Rosa lives. She is a 44-year old woman who has two children. Both little ones go to school.

Rosa says that she started her business 24 years ago with three sewing machines. She is happy because she has always liked her profession, and thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead and give her children an education. Now that she is a micro-entrepreneur, Rosa has been able to employ another woman, as she can't get all the work done herself. Rosa's business has a good clientele because of the quality of work she turns out.

Rosa has come to Fundación Alternativa for the first time. She feels happy because, with the loan, she will be able to invest in raw materials for making school uniforms. The season of high demand is nearing, as these months are the beginning of the school year.

Rosa is grateful to all of those who make up Fundación Alternativa and especially to Kiva. The loans they grant help many people who need to prosper in their small businesses.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Yola

texts.en: Yola needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Yola has a boyfriend and she has her own house. Yola sells milk but she wants to make cheese now, with the help of her boyfriend. Yola has no children and she doesn't have relatives that can help her with the loan. That is why she needs your help. She is very responsible and she dreams about having a bigger farm some day.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 61 years old. He is married and he has two sons. Victor has a fast food stand that helps him a lot to make money for his family. Victor needs another loan to buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, and oil. Victor has many expenses he has to pay including the rent and taking care of his family. He hopes you can help him again.  In the picture you can see Victor's stand.  His wife helps him with the cooking.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, and oil.

loans.name: Ngasoma Road Group

texts.en:
Imelda, who is in her mid 50s, is a widow with five children: three boys and two girls, and they are all still in school.  She has been running a retail shop for 10 years now. She works from 7 am to 10:30 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Imelda's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit for school fees, covered household expenses and made loan payments.  She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her retail shop. She dreams of having an individual loan.

Imelda will share this loan with her loan group "NGASOMA ROAD", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil etc. for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal El  Triunfo está conformada por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos hombres, madres  y padres responsables de familia con diez hijo bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron terminar sus estudios, y se dedicaron a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos de hogar, en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
En la actualidad la coordinadora es Paula y tiene por actividad económica una pulperia , es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, queso, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas. La rutina de trabajo de Paula es de unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para brindarles buena atención a sus clientes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio con productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comuna EL Triunfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "El Triunfo" (The Victory) communal bank is made up of nine members- seven women and two men.  They are responsible mothers and fathers who care for ten children among them.  They are natives of Malpaisillo, an area located in the region's northern zone.  They are known for being hard-working, responsible people with great desires to improve their situations.  Unfortunately, due to a lack for financial resources, they weren't able to finish school.  They started working at young ages to help with the household expenses.  Now, they work hard each day to offer their children a better future. 
The current coordinator of the communal bank is Paula.
