Her business is a "pulperia," a small store that sells foodstuffs in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, matches, juice and sodas.  Paula's routine is to work about twelve hours a day selling her products so she can offer good customer service to her customers.  The loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with foodstuffs so that in the not too distant future she can earn a better income.  
The "El Triunfo" communal bank is grateful for the Kiva lenders who offer low-income people and poor countries, like Nicaragua, a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing foodstuffs such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, matches, juice and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a septic tank and install a toilet, buy a plastic container for water storage and improve the household hygiene.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis, de 68 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, todos son mayores de edad.

Luis, trabaja como agricultor y cuidando el ganado que tiene desde hace 16 años, obtuvo una buena cosecha de frijol y compro una ternera; fue así como comenzó la crianza de ganado.- Hoy tiene más de 16 animales y dos bueyes, que son los que le ayudan a generar ingresos para su pequeña familia; estos los compro con la ayuda de uno de sus hijo. 

El dinero lo necesita para comprar bloques, arena, cemento, lamina y madera para mejorar el lugar donde alimenta sus animales y que no se mojen en tiempo de lluvia.

Con mucho esfuerzo le ha dado todo lo necesario a su nieta para que estudie y ahora que tiene su título de enfermera, su mayor sueño es ver a su nieta con un buen empleo.
texts.en:
Luis is 68 years old and went to school until third grade. He is married and has 3 children, all of whom are adults.

Luis works as a farmer and cares the livestock that he has had for 16 years. He had a good bean harvest and bought a calf - and so he began raising livestock. He now has over 16 animals and 2 oxen, which help him make money for his small family. He bought them with the help of one of his children.

He needs this loan to buy cinder blocks, sand, cement, sheet metal, and wood to improve the place where he feeds his animals so they don't get wet in the rainy season.

Through hard work, he has given his granddaughter everything she needs to go to school, and now she has a degree in nursing. His greatest dream is to see his granddaughter secure a good job.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, sand, cement, sheet metal, and wood to improve the place where he feeds his animals so they don't get wet in the rain

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.en: Luis Angel is 20 years old. He had to drop out of school to cover some family expenses. He lives with his mother, brother and cousins in his grandparents' house where they don't pay rent. Luis Angel and his brother started a spare parts retail business, and both help with the household expenses. Occasionally, they buy cars recovered by insurance companies, fix them and sell them. He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts to comply with some clients' orders.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 60 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 12 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, con ellos vive 1 hija y dos nietos.

Isabel, por mucho tiempo se dedicó a la albañilería, hasta que tuvo un accidente que le fracturó muchas partes de su cuerpo, desde entonces solo se dedica a la agricultura y a recolectar semilla de marañón en su época, ya que tiene una finca desde el 2013.

Isabel, necesita el crédito para comprar lámina y madera para mejorar su vivienda, ya que en ésta época es cuando puede repararla porque no hay lluvia.

Su sueño es vender la semilla de marañón en grandes cantidades y colocar u negocio con esta fruta.
texts.en:
Isabel is 60-years old.  He went to school until 9th grade.  He is married, and his wife is a homemaker.  Isabel has twelve children, all of whom are grown.  One daughter and two grandchildren live with him and his wife.  

Isabel made his living as a bricklayer for a long time, until he had an accident that broke a lot of his body.  Since then, he has made his living in agriculture and harvesting cashew seeds in their season.  He has had a farm since 2013.

Isabel needs the loan to purchase sheet metal and wood to make improvements to his home.  This is the season to do it because it isn't rainy. 

Isabel's hope is to sell cashew seeds in large quantities and set up a cashew business.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal and wood to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus sells many kinds of appliances and he needs a loan to buy pans, stakes and other kinds of products. He is divorced but he found a woman and he had a baby with her. Jesus has his own house and he is doing his best to give a good life to his new family. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy pans, stakes and other kinds of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a septic tank, install a toilet, and buy a plastic tank to store water because the area lacks this vital liquid

loans.name: Lucia Nohemi

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 25 años es soltera, tiene un hijo viven en casa arrendada en el sector de Chaltura, sector donde hay tradiciones en platos típicos como los cuyes con papas que son visitados por turistas.
Lucia se dedica a la venta de comida rápida desde hace 1 año atrás en el sector de Chaltura le va muy bien en su negocio la actividad lo aprendió por iniciativa propia tiene clientes que les va hacer gasto en su negocio de comida rápida como salchipapas, papas con huevo, tiene el apoyo de la familia en todo momento y quiere demostrar todo lo que ella puede hacer con su negocio dar lo mejor para su hijo brindarle la educación necesario y que siga por el camino del bien y que se haga un hombre de bien.
Con el crédito que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de una nueva cocina y refrigeradora para tener en buenas condiciones los productos y ofrecer en buen estado la comida que brinda en su negocio.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por todo el apoyo que le brindan para seguir creciendo junto con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 25 years old and single. She has a son, and they live in a rented house in the Chaltura district, where there is a strong tradition of customary dishes such as guinea pig with potatoes, which is sought out by tourists.

For the past year, Lucia has made a living selling fast food in the Chaltura district. Her business is going very well. She learned the trade by her own initiative. She has customers who buy her fast food such as kebobs and potatoes and eggs. She always has the support of her family, and she wants to show how much she can accomplish, providing the best for her son and giving him the education he needs. She wants him to follow a good path in life and become a good man.

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a new stove and refrigerator so she can keep her ingredients in good condition and offer quality food through her business.

She thanks Fundación Alternativa for all the support it provides her to continue growing along with her business.

loans.use: to buy a new stove and refrigerator, so she can have good quality products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in edible products, basic grains, and Eskimo ice cream with the goal of attracting more customers through the children, which will allow her to increase her sales and improve her family economy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed and medication

loans.name: Kadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place depuis le 06 Décembre 2010. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadidiatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants (02 garçons et 02 filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaire. Elle s’approvisionne à Kolda pour le revendre dans son village. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs de sucre à 15000f l’un et 12 paquet de thé à 800f  l’un,  pour les revendre en détail.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les frais médicaux de sa famille et de s’occuper de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group has been in existence since December 6, 2010. It is composed of women determined to change their life conditions. They all live in the same village and maintain a spirit of solidarity and mutual help. They mainly work as vendors.

Mrs. Kadidiatou (the one standing on the right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of four: two boys and two girls. She sells food products. She stocks up in Kolda and then resells the merchandise in her village.

With this loan, she plans to buy four bags of sugar at 15,000 West African francs each and 12 packs of tea at 800 francs each, for retailing. Her earnings will allow her to pay for the healthcare expenses of her family and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy four bags of sugar and 12 packs of tea for retailing.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en: Mateo has a wife and a son. The son is going to school. Mateo has his own house and he makes hats to make money. He makes hats for men and women. He has his own workshop at his home. Mateo sells his hats at Batallas and Escoma. He needs a loan to buy supplies to make more hats. Mateo wants to increase his sales and have a bigger workshop in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make more hats

loans.name: Nilton

texts.en: Nilton is 44 years old and he has a wife and two kids. Nilton is still living in his parents' house and is still driving a car to make some money. Nilton needs money to buy spare parts for his car. He is alone because his wife is traveling to another part of the country to attend to some family issues but she will be back soon.  Meanwhile, Nilton needs some help because he is the only one who earns money at his home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Olber

texts.en: Olber is 20 years old and he is a carpenter. He works at a workshop where he receives a salary. Olber is married and his wife had a baby recently. He is happy with his family.  Olber works from 8:00 am to 17:00 pm.  He needs a loan to buy a carpentry machine to be an independent carpenter. Olber wants to open his own workshop and to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a carpentry machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is married and she has four children. She and her husband have a car and they use it as a taxi. Virginia's husband is a police officer but he is serving in Santa Cruz right now. Virginia needs a loan to build a couple of rooms at her own house for her children. Virginia is responsible and healthy and she is taking good care of her children's needs. Her husband helps her but for this project they need extra support. She hopes you can help her. Virginia is with her husband in the picture.

loans.use: to build a couple of rooms for her children

loans.name: Andres Luis

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre de 44 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años y su negocio es el servicio de amplificación de sonido.
El es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona de la ‘Mutualista’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas de empresas, universidades e instituciones. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Andres es de tez morena, cabello negro gris corto, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte solamente con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de amplificación, que consiste en animar eventos, fiestas, cumpleaños y todo tipo de acontecimientos, con un aviso publicado en el periódico recibe llamas y agenda los eventos para evitar cruces de fechas. “trabajé durante varios años en una empresa de eventos manejando el sonido, donde obtuve los conocimientos sobre ese rubro, actualmente decidí independizarme y trabajar por mi propia cuenta…” comenta. Su sueño es tener ser reconocido por su buen servicio. El desea desarrollar su negocio de sonido realizando la compra de equipos de sonido, como amplificadores y otros. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Andres solicita un préstamo para desarrollar su negocio de sonido comprando equipos de sonido.
texts.en:
Andres is a 44 year old man, married with three children of 15, 10, and 8 years, and his business is sound amplification services.

He is a good father, an entrepreneur, independent, responsible, and hard working.  He carries out his business as a street vendor in the “Mutualista” zone, a commercial area located in the center of the city, characterized by having the majority of business offices, universities, and institutions.  It has a warm, tropical, humid climate, with a temperature approximately between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius all day.

Andres has a dark complexion, short grey-black hair, and dark eyes.  His native language is Guaraní, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and because of the business he works in. He shares his life only with his children, who are in school.  He lives in a rented house, built of brick, which has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.  His business is sound amplification services, which consists of livening up events, parties, birthdays, and all types of occasions. From a notice published in the newspaper, he receives calls, and he schedules the events to avoid schedule conflicts.  He comments, “I worked for several years in an event business managing sound, where I found out about this listing.  Now, I have decided to become independent and work on my own.”  His dream is to be recognized for his good service.  He wants to develop his sound business by purchasing sound equipment, such as amplifiers and others items.  This is his fourth loan cycle with the lending institution during the 15 years in which he has been carrying out this activity.

It is for these reasons that Andres is requesting a loan to develop hi business by purchasing sound equipment.

loans.use: to develop his business by purchasing sound equipment.

loans.name: Jaygladish

texts.en:
Jaygladish raises and sells hogs. She is a 25-year-old married woman with two young children residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. In addition to raising pigs, she also toils the land and farms. She grows and sells rice.

It has been five years now that she has engaged in that kind of business.

She has requested a loan to buy pig feed and supplements, and purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. These tools are very essential in augmenting her hog-raising business as well as in her farming livelihood. She will be selling more hogs in the coming months and starting to gain more harvest from her farm.
 
She hopes that she will be able to handle both her sources of income to provide her family with better living conditions, to support the needs of her growing children and also to become more sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplements, and purchase  farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 38-year-old married woman with three children from Talibon, Bohol.  She engages in raising and selling and hogs.  Aside from that, she grows and sells rice. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 11 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. This will help Jenifer grow and sell more pigs. It will also improve the yield of her farm. With these, her earnings will improve and it will help continue sending her children to school. 

In the future, she dreams of expanding both her businesses to make them productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed an farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 54-year-old married woman with eight children. Three of them are still attending school. She earns a living by growing and selling seaweed. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for 10 years already. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter.

Herminigilda is asking for a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, and materials like rope and tissue paper. These will be of great help in improving her livelihood. She will be harvesting a greater yield and selling it at the local market in her community. With this, she will able to provide her family with nutritious diets. She could now continue financing the education of her children.

She dreams of expanding her seaweed farming business to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase seaweed seedlings, and materials like rope and tissue paper.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia engages in fishing. She sells fish and crabs to the locals in her area. She is a married woman with six children. Two of them are still attending school. She is 52 years old and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets. These tools will improve her catch and increase her daily income. She could now continue to send her children to college, and prepare healthy foods.

Eufemia is hoping that she could expand her fishing livelihood to make it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a small dairy farmer; he sells his cows' and sheep's milk for a living. The investment in a biodigester is an important step for his farm, as he will produce his own renewable energy and organic fertilizer from his animals' manure. This will allow him to displace the expensive LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizer he used to buy for his farm's operations. As he becomes more self-sufficient and starts saving money, he is looking to diversify his current product offering and expand it to selling yogurt and cheese as well. In addition to becoming more cost-effective and diversified, his farm will become increasingly sustainable, as waste will be transformed into a useful productive resource instead of contaminating underground water sources and the atmosphere. In addition, fossil fuel-based products will be eliminated from the farm. The soil of Mario's field will be nourished with natural nutrients and become more fertile in the long term, increasing the crops' yield.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the expansion and improvement of her property.

loans.name: Nery Gloribel

texts.es: Nery, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. En busca de obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, hace un año ella estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, jabon, refrescos, galletas, dulces,harina, medicamentos comunes, condimentos, churros, refrescos etc. y ya cuenta con su clientela. Decidió solicitar n préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar mas productos alimenticios como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, carnes, refrescos, huevos, pan, harina, manteca, productos de aseo etc, con el propósito de incrementar el inventario y las ventas y hacer crecer el negocio. Con el préstamo va poder comprar de contado y a mejor precio. Su meta es utilizar las ganancias para el estudio de su hija hasta que se gradúe.
texts.en: Nery is 39 years old.  She is a single mother because she is a widow.  She has two children, and lives in a village in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara.  Seeking to obtain income to support her children, one year ago she established her own general store business where she sells rice, beans, lard, sugar, soap, soft drinks, cookies, sweets, flour, common medicines, condiments, churros, soft drinks, and so on.  She already has her own clientele.  She decided to request a loan of 25,000 Lempiras to buy more food products, such as sugar, rice, beans, meat, soft drinks, eggs, bread, flour, lard, personal care products, etc., for the purpose of increasing her inventory and sales, and making her business grow.  With the loan, she will be able to buy with cash and at a better price.  Her goal is to use her profits for her daughter’s studies until she graduates.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, meat, soft drinks, eggs, bread, flour, lard, personal care products, and other groceries to supply her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of his cows' and sheep's manure to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer. He is motivated to increase the yield of his corn field in a sustainable way, and is looking forward to applying the nutrient-rich biofertilizer produced by the biodigester on his crops without using any chemical fertilizers. The biogas will be connected directly to the cookstove and boiler in his house, allowing the household to displace the expensive LP gas and the wood they used to cook with. The wood was producing toxic smoke the family was inhaling on a daily basis, and its elimination will lead to important health benefits. Francisco will therefore not only be able to reduce his operating costs, but he will also protect the environment and his family by treating his animals' manure and displacing fossil fuel. With his savings, Francisco plans to invest in increasing his milk production, and buy additional cows.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth engages in farming. She toils the land and grows rice. She is a married woman with two children. She has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years now.
 
Elizabeth has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. These farming supplies will definitely help her farm improve its yield. She will be harvesting quality rice and slowly augmenting her earnings. She will be providing healthy diets to the whole family and a better shelter in which to live.

In the future, she is determined to expand her farming livelihood to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mauro Cayetano

texts.es: Cayetano es un señor de 72 años, viudo, vive en casa propia ubicada en el Rcto Virgen del Cisne vía a El Carmen. Un recinto caracterizado por la producción de yuca y plátano para exportación.  Hace 7 años falleció su esposa y esto le afectó mucho, incluso se enfermó; con el apoyo de sus hijos Cayetano se puso  una tienda, ahora ya lleva 6 años en el negocio, también vende frutas de la zona, un negocio bien ubicado ya que se encuentra en la vía que lleva a las playas de la Costa y varios turistas visitan su negocio. Dedica 6 horas a su tienda todos los días, también dedica un día a la semana a su producción de yuca que tiene en  terrenos de familiares.  Cayetano acudió a Fundación Alternativa porque una clienta de la institución le recomendó y le manifestó que a más de dar un crédito también brindan capacitaciones a los clientes y este servicio le llamó mucho la atención a Cayetano, ahora es cliente fiel a la institución y va por su segundo crédito, invertirá en mercadería para su tienda seguir incrementándola y también va a invertir en la producción de yuca. Se siente agradecido por darle la oportunidad de seguir mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
Cayetano is a 72-year-old gentleman, and a widow.  He lives in his own house, which is located in the Virgen del Cisne Settlement on the way to El Carmen. It is known for the production of yucca and plantains for export. 

His wife died 7 years ago, and this affected him very much; it even made him ill. With his children’s help, he opened a store, and he has had the business for 6 years now.  He also sells fruit in the zone. His business is well located, as it is on the way to the coastal beaches, and many tourists stop there. He devotes 6 hours to his store every day, and he also devotes one day a week to his production of yucca that he has on some family land.

Cayetano went to Fundación Alternativa because a client of the institution recommended it, telling him that in addition to providing loans, it also offered training classes to the clients.  This service attracted Cayetano very much, and now he is a faithful client of the institution. He is going for his second loan, which he will invest in the production of yucca.

He is thankful to be given the opportunity to keep improving more and more.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his store, and to invest in his production of yucca.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lay ceramic tile in his home, which will allow him to improve its condition and live in a healthy environment.

loans.name: Cibeji Group

texts.fr: Représentant du groupe CIBEJI, Justin ,dont la main est levée sur photo, a hérité avec ses frères du champ de café de leur père. Il se plaint non seulement de l'absence d'un marché sûr pour l'écoulement de sa production mais aussi du manque de matériels spécialisés pour l'entretien de son champ. Toutefois, il souhaite assurer la scolarisation et les soins médicaux de sa famille, acheter un autre champ pour d'autres cultures et que PAIDEK accroisse prochainement leur montant de crédit.
texts.en:
Justin is the representative of the Cibeji Group.  He is seen in the photo with his hand raised.  He and his brothers have inherited a coffee field from their father.  Unfortunately they suffer from problems finding a market for their crop and also a lack of specialised equipment to work their field.

However, Justin would like to be able to pay for schooling and medical care for his family.  He would also like to be able to buy another field so that he can grow other crops.

In the future, Justin would like to increase the loan that he has with the field partner, Paidek.

loans.use: to effectively work his coffee field.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010, lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Diénabou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants  dont 03 garçons et 03 filles. Elle est vendeuse de denrée alimentaire et gère aussi un restaurant. 

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter du café Touba d’une valeur de 1500f les 5 kg 5kg de sucre à 500f le kg, 2 sacs de riz à 13500f le sac et de l’huile à 15000f les 20 litres pour revendre ses plats à 600 f.

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de scolarisation de ses enfants et d’assurer la dépense quotidienne de ses enfants..
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was created on 14th December 2010 at the inauguration of the field partner office.  The group of women all live in the same village and have just started their ninth loan cycle.  Their group is very close-knit and they all support one another.

Diénabou (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the group representative and, like the other members of the group, she is a small retailer.  She is 45 years old, married and mother to six children, three boys and three girls.  She sells food products and also runs a restaurant business.  Her latest loan will be used to buy Touba coffee (1,500 francs CFA for 5 kgs), sugar (500 francs CFA a kilo), 2 sacks of rice (13,500 francs CFA a sack) and oil (15,000 francs CFA for 20 litres).  She sells her food for 600 francs CFA a dish.

With her profits, Diénabou will pay for schooling for her children and also meet their day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy Touba coffee, sugar, rice and oil for resale and for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: NOGAYE est une femme très brave qui habite à un quartier non loin du Guichet. Elle évolue dans la coiffure. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est très familiarisée avec le guichet car elle est à son 4ème crédit et demande ce dernier pour acheter et vendre des produits cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminée à 18h. NOGAYE aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir, elle souhaite ouvrir d’autres salons de coiffure dans le grand marché central de la ville. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter  ses revenus et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Nogaye is a courageous woman who lives in a neighbourhood close to the field partner's office.  She works in hairdressing.  Nogaye is married and has children.  She is well-known to the field partner as this will be her fourth loan.  She wants the loan so she can buy cosmetic products.

Nogaye has more than ten years' experience in her business and works from nine in the morning until six in the evening.  She helps her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household, and the school fees of their children.

In the future, Nogaye would like to open other hair salons in the main town market.  This would increase her revenue and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and accessories for her hair salon.

loans.name: Karen Celena

texts.es:
Karen  es una joven  mujer de 19 años, es  soltera vive en casa de los padres desde hace algún tiempo, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz, actualmente está estudiando en la universidad y es ella quien se paga sus estudios y a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo, esta actividad la realiza todos los días a partir del medio día y los fines de semana.
Por motivos económicos muy duros en su familia  tuvo que trabajar desde muy temprana edad y así poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar, este negocio ha sido su gran ayuda y es por eso que hoy solicita un crédito para invertir en mas mercadería, lo cual le ayudará a tener mayor solvencia y utilidad.
Tiene buenas referencias del sector, tiene capacidad y carácter de pago por el trabajo extra que ella realiza, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por la ayuda que le brindan ya que podrá cumplir uno de sus tantos sueños emprendedores.
texts.en:
Karen is 19 years old, single and lives with her parents. She was born in the city of Latacunga in La Matriz province. She is currently studying at university; she pays for her own education. Karen also works selling clothes from a catalogue. She works every weekday from midday and at the weekends.

For difficult financial reasons at home, Karen had to work from a young age in order to help with household costs. Her clothes business has been a great help and so today she is applying for a loan to buy more merchanidise, which will give her greater solvency and higher profits.

Karen has good references locally. She has the knowledge and personality to do this work. Karen is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the help provided as it will allow her to achieve one of her many enterprising entrepreneurial dreams.

loans.use: to buy more merchanidise to help for her university studies and to help her parents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a small shed and buy chickens as she wants to raise poultry in order to have another source of income.

loans.name: Mirian Patricia

texts.es:
Mirian es  una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, viven en casa de los padres ya que es soltera , por falta de recursos económicos y la difícil situación de su familia solo pudo terminar con los estudios secundarios, sin embargo María no se dio por vencida y desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, y para ser apoyo a su familia en los gastos , tiene un hijo pequeño y tampoco cuenta con el apoyo del padre, viven en un sector extremadamente rural de la ciudad de Latacunga  ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador.
Mirian es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su hogar, ha trabajado desde muy joven en la agricultura y crianza de y venta de borregos,  ella está muy preocupada por  ser un apoyo para su pequeño hijo y su familia ayudar en la economía de su hogar es por eso que está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semilla para sembrar cebolla lo cual servirá para  mejorar su estilo de vida. 
Mirian agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Mirian is a young woman. At 20 years old, she is single and lives with her parents. Owing to the lack of money and her family’s difficult situation, Mirian could only finish secondary school but continue no further in education. Nevertheless, Mirian does not feel defeated. From a young age she had to work hard to support her family with household costs. Mirian has a young son but receives no help from the father. Mirian lives in a very rural area near Latacunga city, in the Cotopaxi province of Ecuador.

Mirian is very enterprising, hard-working and dedicated to her household. She has worked in farming and the raising and selling of lambs since a very young age. Mirian worries about supporting her young son and family, and helping with the household economy. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to grow onions and improve her lifestyle.

Mirian is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making growth in her professional and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds to improve her lifestyle and support her young son.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María vive en una comunidad muy tranquila donde las personas aún conservan su lengua mazahua y se caracterizan por ser muy amables. María y su familia se sienten afortunados de vivir en un lugar lleno de tradiciones y cultura.

María tiene 44 años, es muy trabajadora, amable y sonriente; está casada con el señor Basilio y juntos han formado una familia con seis hijos de los cuales ya solo tres dependen de ellos y únicamente dos asisten a la escuela primaria.

Doña María era enemiga de las deudas, sin embargo sus vecinas la animaron a tomar un primer préstamo. “Recuerdo que fue una cantidad muy pequeña, no me agradaba el hecho de deber dinero”, pero ese pequeño capital le ayudó a iniciar la cría y engorda de borregos y los créditos dejaron de ser algo desconocido, además de que fueron un apoyo para seguir aumentando el número de sus animales.

Posteriormente, ella y sus compañeras de grupo decidieron buscar una mejor opción de préstamos y encontraron a VisionFund  México. Para ese entonces, María se daba cuenta que tenía que dedicar más y más tiempo a sus borregos y que se alejaba de su familia, así que decidió comenzar a vender ropa.

Ya son ocho años los que lleva vendiendo ropa en la misma comunidad o en otras. Todos los lunes viaja hasta la capital del país para comprar mercancía al mayoreo y tiene alrededor de 40 clientes seguros que siempre le hacen pedidos espaciales. María recuerda que al principio de la actividad pasaba los días caminando por las calles, ahora el negocio ha crecido y con las ganancias pudo comprar un vehículo donde ya transporta toda la ropa. Con el objetivo de incentivar sus ventas, María permite que los clientes liquiden las prendas en pagos aunque hay ocasiones en las cuales se vuelve complicado, pero ella no se desanima. “De alguna manera tengo que arriesgarme para poder captar más clientes”.

Ella y su familia están muy agradecidas con Vision Fund y KIVA porque ahora podrá comprar mas ropa con el nuevo préstamo que solicita y porque ha traído grandes beneficios, su vivienda ha mejorado, cuando su esposo se encuentra desempleado ella puede solventar perfectamente los gastos de sus hijos.

“Quisiera tener más clientes seguros que me compren para así poder ayudar a mi hija que está estudiando. Ella tiene muchas ganas de realizarse profesionalmente, no me gustaría que por falta de ingresos económicos no pudiera lograr su sueño” Comento Doña María al expresar su mayor anhelo.

*La fotografía fue fue tomada en la comunidad de María, en una milpa donde se cultiva maíz.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a very quiet community where people still speak the mazahua language and are characterized by being very kind. Maria and her family feel very lucky to live in a place full of traditions and culture. 
Maria is 44 years old, she is very hard-working, kind, and smiles a lot. She is married to Brasilio, and together they have formed a family with six children, of which only three still depend on them, and only two go to elementary school.
Maria was an enemy of debts, but her neighbors encouraged her to take out her first loan. “I remember it was a very small amount, I did not like having to owe money.” But that small amount of capital helped her to start the breed and fattening of sheep, and the loans stopped being something unknown, and they were also a source of support to keep increasing the number of her animals. 
Afterwards, she and her partners in the group decided to look for a better loan option, and found VisionFund Mexico. By then, Maria was realizing that she had to spend more and more time with her sheep and was distancing herself from her family, so she decided to start selling clothing.
She has been selling clothing for eight years now, in the same community and in others. Every Monday she travels to the capital to purchase merchandise at wholesale, and she has already more than 40 loyal clients who always make special orders. Maria remembers that when she started working, she spent the days walking through the streets. Now the business has grown, and with the income she was able to buy a vehicle with which she transports all the clothing. With the goal of incentivizing her sales, Maria allows her clients to pay for the garments in payments, although there are times when it gets complicated, but she does not get discouraged. “In some way, I have to take a risk to be able to get more clients.”
She and her family are very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva, because now they can purchase more clothing with the new loan she is asking for, and because it has brought great benefits. Her house has improved, and when her husband is unemployed, she can settle the expenses of her children.
“I would like to have more stable clients to be able to help my daughter who is studying. She really wants to fulfill herself professionally, I would not like that she could not achieve her dream because of a lack of economic income” says Maria, when expressing her biggest dream. 
*The photograph was taken in Maria’s community, in a cornfield where maize is cultivated.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

location.town: El Valerio San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, iron, etc. to build a covered galley in the laundry area.

loans.name: Izhozat

texts.ru: Ижозат 45 лет, замужем, 2 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 2000 году Ижозат начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 13,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В хозяйстве есть 1 дойная корова и 3 бычка. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ижозат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров с телятами для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы Ижозат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Izhozat is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 2000.  She started with a capital of 13,000 som (KGS) and now makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products.  She has one dairy cow and three young bulls on her farm.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy two dairy cows with their calves, which will help her to produce and sell higher volumes of organic milk.  Izhozat is planning to use her earnings to further expand her farming business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows with their calves in order to produce and sell higher volumes or organic milk.

loans.name: Melvin De Jesus

texts.es:
Melvin, de 22 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a oficios domesticos, tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad y estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica. 

Melvin, es empleado por más de cuatro años; decidio trabajar muy fuerte para sostener a su familia, su día de descanso en su empleo, lo aparovecha para trabajar en el negocio de su cuñado, para obtener un ingreso económico extra, la distancia que viaja en bus, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo es de 5 kilómetros desde su casa.

Melvin, utilizará el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, esto le ayudará mucho como medio de transporte y mejorará su condición de vida.

El sueña con trabajar muy fuerte, para poder darles un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Melvin, 22, lives with his life partner, who takes care of the domestic tasks, and their eight-month-old son.  Melvin has a sixth grade education and he has been employed for four years.  He decided to work hard to support his family, and he takes advantage of his day off to work at his brother-in-law's business to earn extra income.  He rids a bus to work which is five kilometers from his home.

Melvin will use the loan to buy a motorcycle to help with transportation and improve his lifestyle.  His goal is to work even harder to give his family the best future he can.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos que viven en su casa y estan estudiando.

Julio, tiene ganado de repasto, ha tenido ganado por más de 20 años y lo aprendió de su papà; decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso econòmico para sostener a su familia, tambien trabaja la agricultura y hace viajes con su pick-up.

Antes, solo era empleado jornal, la distancia que camina para llegar hasta donde está su ganado, es de 1 kilómetro desde su casa, se involucra su compañera de vida y sus hijos cuando no tienen clases.

Julio, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, el préstamo le ayudará mucho porque podra tener más ganado, sin tener que vender los que ya tiene.

Sus sueños son poder trabajar lo mejor que se pueda para poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia y en cuanto a sus hijos para que estos puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Julio, 44, has a sixth grade education.  He lives with his life partner, who takes care of the domestic tasks, and they have three children who lives at home and attend school.

Julio raises cattle which he has been doing for over 20 years, having learned the trade from his father.  He decided to go into this business to earn an income to support his family.  He also works in agriculture and uses his pick-up truck for transportation.

He used to be a day laborer.  He walks a kilometer from home to the pasture where the livestock are.  His partner helps out, as do his children when they are not in class.

Julio is in need of a loan to buy cattle for grazing.  The loan will be of much help because he will be able to have more livestock without having to sell what he has now.

His dream is to work as much as he can to give his family, including his children, a better future.

loans.use: To buy cattle for grazing.

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.ru: Санчар молодой неженатый парень. Ему 21 год и он живет вместе с родителями. Образование у Санчара не полное высшое. Он перевелся на заочную форму образования так как должен помогать родителям  зарабатывая на жизнь и свою учебу. Он очень трудолюбивый парень. Санчар  оказывает услуги населению занимается съемкой  свадебных  мероприятий. В этом году он хочет помочь родителям в ремонте дома. И внести свой вклад оплатив услуги установки окон и дверей. Не смотря на свой молодой возраст он уже брал кредит и смог  самостоятельно досрочно погасить заем.Санчар благодарен поддержке и пониманию "Арванд"
texts.en: Sanjar, age 21, is a young man who is still single and who lives with his parents.  He hasn't completed his higher education yet.  He actually transferred to distance learning because he has to help his parents to make a living and to pay for his own education.  Sanjar is very hardworking.  He provides video-recording services to the local residents during weddings. This year, he wants to help his parents to renovate their house.  He will contribute by paying for the installation of new windows and doors.  In spite of his young age, he has already taken a loan, which he was able to pay off by himself before the repayment term.  Sanjar is thankful for MDO Arvand's support and understanding.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of new windows and doors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a septic tank, install a toilet and sewage plumbing so as to maintain hygiene and prevent her family from getting illnesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy felt, molds, prints and other tools.

loans.name: Miharisoa

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de deux enfants de 11 et 6 ans, Miharisoa a 38 ans. Elle tient un magasin de  Quincaillerie depuis plusieurs années ,depuis toute jeune en débutant à aider ses parents.Au début, le magasin appartenait à ses parents mais puisque ces derniers sont en retraites, c'est elle qui l' hérite.
C'est une femme très travailleuse car à part l'exercice de cette activité, elle s'occupe de sa maison et de ses enfants sans l'aide de personne.
Dans le but de renforcer ses fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt, avec lequel, elle va acheter des différentes sortes de peintures: à l'huile et à l'eau
Miharisoa espère augmenter les bénéfices de sa vente pour pouvoir assurer l'éducation de ses enfants et l'économie de la famille car le revenu de son mari en tant que chauffeur de taxi n'est pas stable.
texts.en:
A married mother of two children, aged 11 and 6, Miharisoa is 38 years old. She has owned a hardware store for several years. She started working in this business when she was very young by helping her parents. First, the store belonged to her parents. When they retired, she inherited it. 

She is a very hardworking woman because on top of her work, she also takes care of her household and children without anybody's help.

With the goal of strengthening her working capital, she is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of paint: water and oil based. 

Miharisoa hopes to increase her sales income to be able to reliably cover her children's education and the family finances because her husband's income as a taxi driver is not stable.

loans.use: to buy oil- and water-based paints

loans.name: Davidine

texts.fr:
Coiffeuse de formation, Davidine a depuis deux ans sa propre salon de coiffure (réalisation de son rêve d'enfance), si auparavant, elle  travaillait entant que salariée durant huit ans. Elle est donc devenue la patronne d'elle-même.

Elle travaille dure, encore en phase d'investissement, c'est pourquoi la demande de crédit. Le prêt va être utilisé pour l'achat des produits  de soins et de traitements de chevelures (shampoings,sérums, masques, coloration) ainsi que pour l'achat de matériels  comme le fer à lisser.
 
En effet le crédit va lui permettre d'améliorer la qualité de ses services: satisfaire les demandes des clients et en attirer d'autres.L'objectif, c'est d'augmenter le revenu pour que la famille puisse avoir une sécurité économique et encore investir davantage dans le salon . 

C'est une mère de deux enfants de 12 et 8 ans, tous scolarisés, mariée à un vendeur et a 40 ans.
texts.en:
A hairdresser by trade, Davidine has been running her own hair salon (her childhood dream ) for the past two years. Previously, she worked as an employee for eight years. She has therefore become her own boss.

She works hard, still in the investment phase, which is why she is asking for a loan. The loan will be used to purchase haircare and treatment products (shampoos, serums, masks, color) as well as materials, such as a straightening iron. 

This loan will allow her to improve the quality of her services: satisfy the demand of her existing clients and attract new clients. Her goal is to increase her income, so that her family can benefit from economic security and she can continue to invest in her salon. 

She is the mother of two children, ages 12 and 8, both in school. She is married to a reseller and is 40 years old.

loans.use: to buy a straightening iron, shampoo, serums, hair color, masks, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de guayabas, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, bolsas para protección, etc. y así poder tener un mejor cultivo y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 57, lives in her own house with her family.  For ten years she has been growing guayabas which she sells, along with other produce, at different markets near her home.  She has many customers and uses the income she earns to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizers, insecticides, protection bags, etc. to improve her crop and earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, protection bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, rods, sand and tile flooring for her house.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалому  59  лет .У него среднее образование.  Он женат имеет 2 взрослых детей .Абдусалом занимается  разведением  мелкого рогатого скота.  Вместе с женой Абдусалом помогает детям растить внуков. Животноводство является основным источником дохода семьи но для того чтобы финансов хватало на жизнь и образование внуков Абдусалому нужно увеличить поголовье скота. Абдусалом  уже брал кредит с «Арванд» и так как  условия его удовлетворяют он хочет еще раз взять для увеличение поголовье скота.  Вырастив на откорм скот он надеется получить хороший доход для  улучшения  финансового положения  своей семьи.
texts.en: Abdusalom is 59 years old.  He has a secondary education.  He is married and the father of two adult children.  He raises small livestock.  He and his wife also help their children with their own children's upbringing.  Animal husbandry is the main source of income for the family, but in order to have enough money to live and to raise the grandchildren, Abdusalom needs to increase his livestock headcount.  He has already taken a loan from MDO Arvand and, since he was satisfied with the conditions of his previous loan, he has decided to take a second loan in order to increase the size of his herd.  After fattening his livestock, Abdusalom is hoping to make a good income and improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Claire Odile

texts.fr:
Claire Odile est très heureuse d'être mariée et mère de ses 3 enfants. Elle a 33 ans. Son mari est mécanicien de formation et elle, restauratrice spécialisée en petit déjeuner: beignets de spécialité malagasy (mofogasy, ramanonaka, menakely,...) et des boissons chaudes (café, thé, cacao, lait,...)  . Elle a commencé cette activité en 2005. Elle travaille toujours dure et seule du lundi au dimanche.

Elle a besoin d'un crédit afin de ravitailler les stock des matières premières (farine, lait,sucre, ...) et de réhabiliter le lieu d'activité (repeindre son lieu de vente), renouveler la vitrine, ajouter quelques tasses et petites cuillères. Tout ceci pour  fidéliser les clients actuels et attirer des nouveaux.

En effet, le crédit va lui permettre d'améliorer son activité et d'augmenter son revenu pour qu'au final, 
elle puisse continuer à scolariser ses enfants et améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Claire Odile is happily married and a mother of 3 children. She is 33 years old. Her husband is a mechanic by trade. She owns a restaurant specialized in breakfast items: Malagasy style donuts (called mofogasy, ramanonaka and menakely in the local language) and hot drinks (coffee, tea, hot chocolate, milk...) She started her business in 2005. She always works hard by herself from Monday to Sunday.

She needs a loan to replenish her stock of ingredients (flour, milk, sugar...) and to renovate her place of business (repaint her restaurant), renew the display case, add some cups and small spoons. With this, she hopes to strengthen her relationship with her existing customers and attract new customers. 

The loan will allow her to improve her business and increase her income, so that in the end, she will be able to continue sending her children to school and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar, cooking oil, wall paint and more cups

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao, de 70 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado, es padre de cuatro hijos, todos están separados de él, su compañera de vida trabaja en oficios de la casa.

Estanislao, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 55 años de edad, oficio que aprendió de su madre, la distancia que camina para llegar a su trabajo es de 3 kilómetros desde su casa y su horario de trabajo comienza a la 6:00 a.m. y regresa a casa a las 5:00 p.m.
 
Estanislao, está solicitando el crédito para la compra de 3 vacas, para tener más producción y más ganancias en un futuro.

Estanislao, sueña con poder construir su propia casa de ladrillo, porque en la que vive es rentada.- Además, sueña en poder tener mayor producción en su ganado, para salir excelente con su crédito.
texts.en:
Estanislao is 70 years old, he studied up to third grade. He is married and is father to four children, all of them live independently. His life partner is a domestic worker.

Estanislao has made a living in agriculture and farming for 55 years, a job he learnt from his mother. He has to walk almost 2 miles to get from home to work. He starts working at 6 am and comes back home at 5 pm.

Estanislao requests this loan to buy 3 cows to increase production and make more profits in the future.

Estanislao wishes to be able to build his own brick house, because now he lives in a rented one. He also wishes to increase production from his livestock to do great with this loan.

loans.use: to buy 3 cows

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: José de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace 7 años a la siembra de maíz, arroz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, José vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder seguir con sus cultivos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old, he has made a living growing corn, rice and vegetables for 7 years. He sells his products in the whereabouts of his place of residence and he already has many customers.

José lives in his own house with his wife.

He requests this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control products, etc. to be able to continue taking care of his crops and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Ganbat, 25 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He is a geologist at the geology institution. His wife provides taxi service to local people. Using his previous loan, he has purchased a heavy truck for rental purpose. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy spare parts and a truck trailer. He will repair and upgrade his heavy truck and increase its efficiency. The  truck trailer will increase the amount of goods he can transport.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and a truck trailer.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a 54-year-old married woman who works hard to help her family.

She has grown rice for 10 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 20 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 52-year-old  married woman with five children, one attends school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria has run a general store for 4 years and requests  18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase shampoo, spices, noodles, canned goods, and eggs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, spices, noodles, canned goods, and eggs.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a 48-year-old married woman with four children.

She has grown rice for 8 years and requests 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She earns additional income raising pigs.

She  works tirelessly to attain of her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is a 58-year-old married woman with five children.

Patrocinia has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins.

She has previously borrowed 3 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two attend school.

Cherry has been in the agricultural business for 5 years and requests  8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins.

She  has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a 50-years-old married woman with three children, two attend school.

Emely has been in the agricultural business for 10 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 3 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sáng

texts.en:
Sáng has grown food for 10 years.  She is a 52-year-old married woman with 2 children who lives in the Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Sáng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sáng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Sáng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

Sáng hopes for her business to do well,  her children to find good jobs, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a tailoring business for 6 years.

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  thread, pins, scissors, and fabric.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  thread, pins, scissors, and fabric.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a fishing business for 3 years.

She requests 3,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishnets and other fishing materials.

In the future, Mylyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishnets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Rosa Group

texts.es: Virginia, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una comunidad del municipio de Yoro. Doña Virginia, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 8 años ella vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, pollo y también calzado y ropa de manera ambulante. Además compra cerdos y los engorda para venderlos en época de navidad. Ha solicitado el segundo préstamo en la institución por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras para comprar mercadería de ropa, calzado y granos básicos como maíz y frijoles para vender. Con las ganancias piensa mejorar su casa y ayudar a crecer y educar a un nieto que vive con ella. El préstamo es grupal y se llama Mujeres de la Rosa, integrado por cinco personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al comercio. Han solicitado un préstamo grupal de 70,000 lempiras para surtir de ropa, granos básicos, abarrotes, calzado y otros para la venta. En la foto esta a la izquierda Reina, Glenda, Elsa de blusa rosado, Virginia de falda cuadriculada y Josefina a la izquierda.
texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old, she lives with her common-law partner and 4 children in a community in the district of Yoro.

Virginia has had her own business for 8 years. She is a street vendor and sells foodstuff, like basic grains and chicken, but also shoes and clothes. She also buys pigs to fatten them and then sell them at Christmas.

She has requested a second loan of 15,000 lempiras from the institution to buy clothes, shoes and basic grains, such as corn and beans, to sell in her business.

With the profits she wants to make improvements in her house and also to help grow and educate a grandchild who lives with her.

Her loan is part of a bigger loan for the group 'Mujeres de la Rosa', made up of 5 members who live in the same community and work as small merchants. They have requested a group loan of 70,000 lempiras to buy merchandise to sell, such as clothes, basic grains, groceries, shoes and other products.

In the picture, from left to right: Reina, Glenda, Elsa (in a pink blouse), Virginia (in a checkered skirt) and Josefina.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and basic grains, such as corn and beans, to sell them.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado pues quedo huérfano y fue por esa razón que él abandonó sus estudios, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a revender granos básicos, es padre de tres hijos y todos estudian.

Luis, se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura desde hace 22 años, trabajo que aprendió de un pariente, su trabajo está a una distancia de 4 kilómetros de su casa, su compañera de vida es quien le colabora en su trabajo, su día de trabajo comienza a las 5:30 a.m. y regresa a casa a las 1:00 p.m. a colaborar en trabajos de la casa.

Luis, está solicitando el crédito para comprar tres vacas de repasto, él espera tener ganancia de una forma rápida y así ayudar a sus hijos en la escuela.

Luis, sueña en poder aumentar la producción de ganado, para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones y que sus hijos puedan graduarse en una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years old. He went to school through the fourth grade. He was orphaned and that is the reason he had to leave school. He is married and his spouse sells basic grains. He is the father of three children and all of them are in school. 

Luis has worked with livestock and farming for 22 years. He learned this work from a relative. His work is 4 kilometers from his house. His life's companion helps him with his work. His work day starts at 5:30 a.m. and he gets home at 1:00 p.m. to help with the housework.  

Luis is asking for the loan to buy three cows to graze. He hopes to have profits quickly and thus help his children at school. 

Luis' dream is to increase his cattle production so that his family can live in better conditions and his children can graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy three cows to graze.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his topographical station.

loans.name: Sahada

texts.en:
Sahada is 44 years old, a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Sahada requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional stock of vegetables and fruits to sell.

Sahada has been in this business for four years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is thankful that she was granted a Php 20,000 loan, which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her food stall business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for Php 15,000, which she will use to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products to cook dishes to sell at her food stall. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Leonisa dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 42, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 26 years.

Mercy requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and ingredients for her business.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 47 years old and has three children.  She is single, and has two children who are still in school.

Eden is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Eden has been in business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Tarhana

texts.en:
Tarhana is 45 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Tarhana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Tarhana has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Tarhana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell purified drinking water business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of purified water to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of purified water to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon, mse and personal collection products. 

Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mergine

texts.en:
Mergine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mergine is 50 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

Mergine has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials like meat, bamboo sticks, hot dogs, etc. for her business.

Mergine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like meat, bamboo sticks, hot dogs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy materials and supplies needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional materials like fabric, cloth and thread that she needs to increase her end products. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Sonia wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to save more for the future of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sewing materials such as fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy raw ingredients and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you would again lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards additional ingredients and supplies like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Amor wants to improve her business so she could sustain and provide for the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pia Jane

texts.en:
Her name is Pia Jane, 30, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to James Manuel, an OFW, and has two children of which one is in high school and one is in elementary school. She works hard to meet their daily household needs, and for the schooling of her children. 

Pia Jane is in a food business; she has operated an eatery stall for a number of years already. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Working class people usually buy their meals at food stalls.  The food is sold at a reasonable price for convenience, and to save money, rather than cooking at home. The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. She cooks well; that is why her food stall is popular in their area, with neighbors and the local working community as her regular customers.  She earns a minimum of Php1,000 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Pia Jane is requesting a Php25,000 loan to buy additional raw ingredients like pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her cooking. She believes that with this financial assistance, her sales and earnings will increase.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial aid that will be extended to her, for it will be a great help in their daily sustenance and for the school needs of her children.

Pia Jane dreams to put up a small eatery to attract more customers. She aims to send her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 50 years old, married, and has six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Catalina has been pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Catalina is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Chona has been in this business for two years. Chona earns additional income from fish and corn vending.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a rug making business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials, like fabric, for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like fabric, for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 38 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from direct selling of Avon products. 

Dina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell. Dina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 36 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Fe has a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline to sell in her business.

Fe has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell in her business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Presentacion requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Presentacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming rice for 30 years, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.
