She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Ilsia

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado de repasto, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto para seguir con su crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 47, lives in her own house with her son.  She has earned a living for several years raising grazing cattle.  She sells her products around the area where she lives and is able to pay for some of her household expenses with what she earns from her sales.

Ana's requesting a loan to buy grazing cattle to continue with her breeding and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies  needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of gallons she uses in their water distribution business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Elsa wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 44, is a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gina has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Gina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like blouses, etc.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like blouses.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 37, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alma has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines. Alma has been in this business for 12 years.

Alma requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy coco lumber to sell in her business.
 
In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coco lumber to sell in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

Jocelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado desde hace 6 años, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 2 novillos para continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man's face has been pixelated because he's 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area.  He has earned a living for six years in agriculture and breeding cattle.  He lives in his own home with his family.

The young man is requesting a loan to buy two calves to continue with the breeding and to be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café desde hace 15 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder tener un ben cultivo para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mauricio, age 53, lives in his own house with his three children.  He has been growing corn, beans, and coffee for 15 years.  When his harvest is ready he stores it in sacks as shown in the photograph.  He then sells them in the surrounding villages.  With the sales that he makes he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  This way he will be able to have good crops in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Erika Dinora

texts.es: Erika de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 6 años a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego venderlos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella esta solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.  para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Erika, age 35, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her three children.  She has been growing corn, beans, and sorghum for six years.  When her harvest is ready she stores it in granaries as shown in the photograph.  She then sells them at the different markets that are close to her house.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  She will do this in order to be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el se dedica a la carpintería desde hace varios años, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y construir una cerca en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: The young man, whose face is pixelated because he is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area, has made a living through carpentry for several years.  The young man lives in his own home with his family. He wants to improve his house by changing the roof and building a wall in the spot shown in the photo, but with what he earns from his job he is not able to do this. For this reason he asks for a loan to buy sheet metal, beams, steel, and to pay for the labor so that his family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, beams, steel, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana is a seamstress and she makes vest and jackets for children Mariana sells the clothes in Desaguadero Mariana lives with her parents Mariana needs a loan to fix the room of her workshop because it is important that the place is safe of the rains. Mariana is a single mother of 2 kids and she works very hard she hopes you can help her Mariana is in the picture with her worker
texts.en: Mariana is a seamstress and she makes vest and jackets for children. Mariana sells the clothes in Desaguadero. She lives with her parents. Mariana needs a loan to fix the room of her workshop because it is important that the place is safe from the rains. Mariana is a single mother of two kids and she works very hard. She hopes you can help her. Mariana is in the picture with her worker.

loans.use: to fix the room of her workshop

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es: Jorge de 53 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con sus cinco hijos en casa propia, Jorge está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 53, has been growing corn and sorghum for several years.  When his harvest is ready he stores it in granaries as shown in the photograph.  He then sells them at the different markets that are close to his house.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  He will do this in order to be able to continue with his work and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Alvaro Cea

texts.es: Álvaro de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos,  comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Álvaro  vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar de cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 50, has earned a living for several years breeding pigs.  He sells them in different markets and is able to get ahead with the household expenses with what he earns from his sales.  He lives in his own house with his life partner.

Álvaro's requesting a loan to be able to buy pigs and concentrated pig feed so he can continue with breeding pigs and earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated pig feed

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la crianza y venta de leche de cabra desde 2 años, vende por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 6 cabras y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 43, lives in his own house with his son.  He has earned a living raising goats and selling goat milk for two years.  He sells throughout the various communities near his house.  He's able to pay for some of his household expenses with what he earns from his sales.

Jorge's requesting a loan to buy six goats so he can keep working and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy six goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood doors and cyclone fencing

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 43 years old and married with three children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, spices, etc.

Amy has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from an internet cafe.

Amy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, spices, etc

loans.name: Ma. Leonie

texts.en:
Ma. Leonie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Leonie is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Leonie  has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Ma. Leonie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es estudiante de la carrera de ciencias agrarias, a la vez que estudia también está trabajando.
Él es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante. Sus metas futuras son seguir estudiando para así conseguir mejores ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de título, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Nestor is from the city of San Lorenzo. He is a student of agricultural sciences. He also works, in addition to studying.

He is a tenacious person who strives to succeed. His future goals are to continue studying in order to earn higher incomes and to help his family.

He is asking for this loan so he can pay for his education and can cover his expenses.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses.

loans.name: Osmin

texts.es: Osmin de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar, maíz y frijol desde hace 36 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Osmin is 64 years old. He lives in his own house with his life companion. He has worked growing sugar cane, corn and beans for the past 36 years. When his harvest is ready he stores it in the silos shown in the photo and later sells it in the area in which he lives. With what he makes from the sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to be able to get higher income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 57 años de edad es viudo y vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y estudia, el se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de tomates, pepinos, chile verde y maíz, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y así podrá tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Manuel is a 57 year old widower. He lives in his own house with his daughter who works and studies. For the past 10 years he has been growing tomatoes, cucumbers, green chilies and corn. He sells his products in the different markets that are close to his house. With his sales he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to continue with his growing and be able to have more income and a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Dixie Gisela

texts.es: Dixie de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella es empleada de una empresa privada desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene en su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cementos, arena, ladrillos, laminas, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Dixie is 39 years old, lives in her own home with her husband, and has been an employee for a private business for several years. With what she makes at work, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. 

Dixie wants to improve her home by building a wall in the spot shown in the photo, but with what she earns at work she is not able to do it.  For this reason she asks for a loan so that she can buy cement, sand, bricks, sheet metal, steel, and to pay for the labor so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, sheet metal, and steel, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: Eva de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la  compra de ladrillos, arena, cemento, hierro, lamina y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su esposo puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Eva is 56 years old, married, and lives in a home with her husband that the couple owns. She has for the past ten years run a store in the home, which generates enough income to meet part of her household budget. 

Eva would like to make improvements to her home, adding a room to the part of the house shown in the photo, but lacks the funds to pay for materials and labor. She's therefore applying for a loan for the purchase of bricks, sand, cement, iron, and galvanized sheeting, and to pay workers to do the job. This loan will thus allow Eva and her husband to enjoy a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand, cement, iron, and galvanized sheeting, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed, and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, iron, and sand and to pay workers to do the job.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco de 62 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, Francisco está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 62 years old and has spent 30 years in agriculture, planting corn and beans. He markets his products in the surrounding towns that are close to home. He lives with his wife and son in his own home.

Francisco is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the soil shown in the photograph, so he can continue with his work and have higher incomes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, de 52 años, quien tiene un grado de estudio de primaria la cual no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de recursos económicos. Ella viuda y es madre de 4 hijos dos que viven en EE.UU y los otros dos le apoyan en sus cultivos de café. A esta actividad se dedica desde hace más de 20 años siendo su difunto esposo quien le enseñara las actividades en compañía de su padre. La tierra que trabaja junto a sus dos hijos es herencia de su padre y otra parte comprada con mucho esfuerzo ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitacion a la cual se traslada caminando siendo apoyada por sus hijos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar los diferentes insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café como abonos, fertilizantes, foliares, plaguicidas entre otros pues también quiere pagar mano de obra para hacer la asistencia más efectiva y sea mejor aprovechada. Con esta compra ella mejorara la presentación de sus plantas, la producción del café y como resultado sus ingresos para el hogar. Aida tiene como meta obtener un excelente resultado en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Aida, 52, finished elementary school but couldn't keep on studying because she lacked the financial resources.  She's a widow and the mother of four children, two of whom live in the United States; the other two help her with her coffee crop.

She has been in this business for more than 20 years, having learned the work from her husband and her father.  The land she farms with her two children is partly inherited from her father and partly bought with great effort.  The land is located two kilometers from her home and she walks there with her children's support.

Aida's requesting the loan to buy various agricultural inputs to take care of her coffee crop, including soil amendments, fertilizer, foliar fertilizer, and pesticide.  She also wants to pay for labor so the help is more effective and advantageous.

With this purchase she'll improve the condition of her plants, her coffee production, and, as a result, her household income.  Aida's goal is to get excellent results this season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and foliar fertilizer, and to pay for labor to help with her coffee crop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Derecho, ella sueña con poder ser una buena abogada excelente que ayude a las demás personas.
Ella está esforzándose al máximo para poder cumplir su meta y poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of Paraguarí and she is studying in her second year of Law. She dreams of becoming an excellent lawyer who helps other people. She is making a maximum effort to achieve her goal and be able to help other people through her profession. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in paying her tuition fees for her studies and in this way continue to struggle for her goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella trabaja como empleada en un comedor desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda poniendo luz eléctrica propia, pero con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales necesarios para poder poner la conexión de luz y así que ella y su familia puedan vivir más cómodos.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her mother. She has worked as an employee in a cafe for several years. With what she obtains from her work she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She wants to improve her house by installing electricity but with what she earns at her work wouldn't cover this expense. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to connect to the electrical grid and then she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to connect to the electrical grid.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es de la ciudad de Pilar, es estudiante y también mamá de un niño de 4 meses. A la par que estudia y es mamá, también trabaja y de esa forma está esforzándose por poder salir adelante.
Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que está luchando por ser alguien en la vida, quiere luchar por un buen futuro para su hijo, para darle todo lo que necesita.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is from the city of Pilar, is a student, and also the mother of a four-month-old child.  At the same time that she is a student and mother, she also works and in this way is pushing herself to get ahead.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman who is struggling to become someone in life.  She wants to fight for a better future for her son and to give him everything that he needs.

She asks for this loan so that she can pay the fees for her university course and thus be able to continue studying as she is doing.  She is grateful for receiving this opportunity to keep on growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: Doña Santos de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasión es para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Santos is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has had a business selling food for 4 years, and with the earnings obtained in sales she is able to cover some household expenses.

She wants to improve her home, building a room in the place shown in the photograph, but the money she obtains from sales is not enough to do it. Therefore, she is asking for a new loan but this time it is to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, and to pay for manual labor. This home addition will allow her and her family to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her child, who is pursuing a degree in college, and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her variety store, Ma. Teresita also dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman someday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Helen Abisai

texts.es: Helen de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 4 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a viernes tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Helen is 35 years old, a single mother, and lives in her own home with her son. She has a beauty salon that she has run for four years. It is located inside her home and she works Monday through Friday. She has many clients and so she has steady work. With the earnings she is able to support her home and family needs. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase beauty salon supplies like creams, shampoos, hair pins, scissors and more. These supplies will help her earn more money and to have a more stable home economy.

loans.use: purchase creams, shampoos, hair pins, scissors etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 51 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years. Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nadia is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Nadia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nadia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Nadia has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Nadia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. Teresa is married and has a business selling fruits and root-crops in the Philippines.

Teresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and root-crops to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and root-crops to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of medicines business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional medicines to sell for her business.

Luz has been in this business for 15 years. Luz earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional medicines to sell in her business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 37 years old and has two children. Emelyn is married, and her two children are still in school.

Emelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Emelyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins.

Emelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 54 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Andrea is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Andrea has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 29 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling root crops and fruits.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Sharifahon

texts.ru: Шарифахон 20 лет, не замужем, детей нет. У Шарифахон - среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, сначала помогая своим родителям, потом самостоятельно. Благодаря упорному труду Шарифахон у нее на сегодняшний день есть 1 корова. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,54 Га, где она выращивает картофель для реализации, также на участке есть парник, в котором растут помидоры и капуста. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шарифахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Шарифахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее деятельности, она хочет накопить на строительство сарая для скота.
texts.en: Sharifahon is 20, unmarried, and has no children. She has a high school education. In search of an additional source of income for her family, she started raising livestock and planting crops, at first with help from her parents, and now on her own. Thanks to her hard work she currently has one cow and a 0.54 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes to sell. She also has a greenhouse where she grows tomatoes and cabbage. She earns 6,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her farm, Sharifahon applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seed potatoes and fertilizers for the soil. She plans to use the profits to continue investing in her farm. She wants to save money to build a barn for livestock.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, gravel, and bricks, etc. to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga de materiales de construcción como madera, fierros, cemento y otros, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 05 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Gabriel espera tener unas mejores condiciones para vivir lo que va a incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 28 years old and has a civil marriage. He lives in the district of Buenos Aires, on the northern coast of Peru. Life here is calm and the residents work in trade and raising smaller livestock.

Gabriel makes a living by offering a transportation service for construction materials like wood, iron, cement and more. He has been doing this for 5 years and has gained experience in his work. He has many good personal and professional references in the area. The present loan will be used to make repairs and to maintain his home that is currently in a bad state. Gabriel hopes to improve his living conditions and his quality of life, as well as that of his family.

loans.use: make repairs and maintain his home.

loans.name: Rozario

texts.es:
Rozario de 45 años soltera, con una hija señorita que cursa estudios superiores. Años atrás trabajaba de cocinera en centros recreativos; es así donde decide abrir su  negocio y de esta manera generar sus propios ingresos con el propósito de pagar los estudios de su hija. Rozario  se dedica a la venta de chupetes, gelatina y refrescos en su casa. El mayor anhelo de Rozario es ver que su hija sea una profesional. Solicito el crédito para comprar mesas y sillas para mayor comodidad a sus clientes. 
Rozario está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva
texts.en:
Rozario is 45 years old, single, and has a young daughter in high school. Years ago she worked as a cook in a recreation center. But she decided to open her own business and earn her own money with the goal of paying for her daughter's schooling. Rozario sells treats, jellos and soft drinks from her home. Her biggest dream is to see her daughter have a professional career. She is asking for a loan to purchase a table and chairs to make her customers more comfortable.

Rozario is very happy to receive this support and help from the lenders at Kiva.

loans.use: purchase a table and chairs.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Paz works hard to support her family.

Paz has a buy and sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Paz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell for her buy and sell vegetables and spices business.

Paz successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a married woman. She is 31 years old.

Asuncion has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Asuncion requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Asuncion has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Asuncion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fish, an ice box, and other materials for her fishing business.

Alma has been in this business for 12 years. Alma earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, an ice box, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos estudian, los los otros tienen sus propias familias, nadie más vive con ella.

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 15 años y está ubicado en su casa y tambien tiene una pequeña tiendita, la cual tambien la tiene en su casa, en el negocio colaboran sus hijos y su día laboral comienza a la 6:00 de la mañana y finaliza a las 3:00 de la tarde.

Rosa, está solicitando el crédito a CREDICAMPO para comprar una refrigeradora, esto permitirá atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecer bebida heladas y tener más ganancias en su venta.

Rosa, sueña con que sus hijos estudien mucho, para que sean profesionales y tengan mejores posibilidades de un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and studied up to the 7th grade. She is a single mother of four children, two of which go to school and the other two have their own families and no longer live with her.

Rosa has been selling pupusas for 15 years and she runs her business from her home where she also has a small store. She gets help from her children in the store where she works from 6am to 3pm every day.

Rosa is asking for a loan from CrediCampo to purchase a refrigerator that will allow her to better serve her customers and offer chilled drinks, helping her to earn more money.

Rosa's dream is to see her children do well in school, to have professional careers and have better working opportunities in the future.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan, born in 1966, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She lives with her husband and her son in Son La city, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s humble civil servant salary, so it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save the little amount left. She now wants to build a facility for the house's sanitation, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for the sanitation work.
	 
She hopes the loan amount will help her family have better living conditions, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for the sanitation work

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 42 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of household goods to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Lanie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell vegetables business.

Lanie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of household goods to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 53 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zosima has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Zosima requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles, zippers, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Zosima has been in this business for 29 years. Zosima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is 61 years old and single.

Wilhelmina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like cooking oil, snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Wilhelmina has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Wilhelmina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like cooking oil, snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 32 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Evelyn has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like pants, shorts, t-shirts, shirts, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like pants, shorts, t-shirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with nine children. With four children currently in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Alicia has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jecel works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling personal collections. Jecel is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her beauty salon business.

Jecel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her business buying and selling vegetables.

Junelyn has been in this business for 4 years. Junelyn earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Junelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Soi's Group

texts.en:
Soi, born in 1985, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of 4 members, including her husband, her two children (one son and one daughter) and her. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Her family has little land and not much money to invest. After deducting all costs for their business, there is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little. However, the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coffee field so she wants to borrow for this purpose.

She expects the loan amount will help her family have a better condition to invest in the coffee and that this year’s coffee crop will bring her family double the productivity of last year. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lim Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 28 años de edad, se dedica al comercio y la agricultura, casada y madre de un hijo quien tiene una edad de 11 meses. Ella se graduó en la secundaria como perito mercantil y contador público pues sus padres hicieron el esfuerzo para que ella culminara su preparación básica. Rebeca tiene aproximadamente 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual aprendió de sus padres por interés propio. Sus clientes son personas muy seguras. La propiedad que ella y su esposo trabajan está ubicada a 20 minutos desde su casa de habitacion a la cual se trasladan caminando. Los planes de rebeca es la ampliación de su propiedad, la siembra de nueva plantilla de café, y el mejoramiento continuo de su producción ya que de ahí es donde ellos generan los ingresos económicos en su hogar y poder asegurar el futuro de su hijo. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico, fertilizantes, abonos, fungicidas, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra para asistir sus cultivos de café y maíz los cuales necesitan ser atendidos antes de que sean infectados por plagas y demás esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva
texts.en:
Rebeca is 28 years old and she makes a living in trade and agriculture. She is married and the mother of one son who is 11 months old. She graduated with a specialty in trade and public administration because her parents worked hard for her to get a basic education. Rebeca has been working for 2 years in her current business, one she learned from her parents because she was interested in their work. And now she has loyal customers.

The property that she and her husband work is located 20 minutes from their home, and they get there by walking. Rebecca has plans to expand their property and to plant a new crop of coffee, as well as to improve her current production. It is from their harvests that they make most of their money and plan for their son's future.

She is asking for a loan to purchase organic manure, fertilizers, regular manure, fungicides, and to pay for labor because they need help in their coffee and corn fields. They need to be tended to quickly before they are infected by any plagues. They are hoping for the support of different lenders at Kiva to help them in their goal.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee and corn fields.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong, born in 1953, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	
Her family’s main occupation is sow breeding and chicken raising. The average income of selling each sow herd is about several dozen million VND. But it is not much after deducting all investment costs. It is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses but not enough to buy food for the next herd. Therefore, she wants to borrow to invest in the breeding.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in breeding with high productivity and that the next sow herd will double her family's income.  She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in breeding.

loans.name: Leah Fe

texts.en:
Leah Fe is a married woman with three children. She is 33 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leah Fe has a buy-and-sell jewellery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewellery to sell to her customers.

Leah Fe has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more jewellery to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Irene has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming rice.

Irene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Gina has been in this business for three years now.

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Percila

texts.en:
Percila is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Percila is 56 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Percila has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Percila requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Percila has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Aileen, 37, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marvin, a driver, and has a child who is still at the Elementary Level. She and her husband work hard to provide for their daily personal and household needs.

Aileen has had a glass fabrication business for three years already. She fabricates glass such as glass windows and sliding glass doors. She is happy that contractors have trusted her to make the glass requirements of the houses and offices they build in their area. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Aileen is requesting a Php 15000 loan which she will use to buy materials used in fabricating glass doors and windows. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good turnout of her business and the financial aid that will be given to her, for it will surely help in their daily sustenance.

Aileen hopes to grow her business and send her child to college to allow her better opportunities for her future. Aileen faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the materials and cost of fabricating glass to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a married woman with five children. She is 48 years old, and two of her children are currently in school. Fe has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (Kiva's partner) to purchase an additional fishing boat for her business. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing boat for her business

loans.name: Resella

texts.en:
Resella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.

Resella requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Resella has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 31 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jovelyn has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en: Sen, born in 1991, is an ethnic Thai woman. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son District, Son La Province, Vietnam.	Her family’s main occupation is farming, so the annual income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. There is not enough saved money to buy fertilizer for the upcoming coffee crop. Therefore, she wants a loan from M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (Kiva's partner) to buy fertilizer for the coffee crop. She expects the loan amount will help her family take care of the coffee garden, and the next coffee harvest will bring her family more income. She will also work hard to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cacah

texts.en:
Cacah lives in Cihideung, Bogor, West Java, located about one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband. They have been blessed with six children (three daughters and three sons). She is working as a factory laborer. She joined Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) (Kiva's partner) a year ago, and she feels happy because she has become an agent for Ruma and learned how to manage a business. 

As a woman, Cacah is excited to be a Ruma agent because she wants to help her husband improve their life. In her community, she is trusted as a mobile payment service provider. As the business grows, Cacah is hoping to get a loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to process more mobile payment services, especially on weekends. The loan will be very useful to help Cacah improve her business and, therefore, her community, which needs access to such services. Cacah is shown in the photo holding a mobile phone. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: FATIMATA  est une femme peulh qui évolue dans la commercialisation du lait, et l’élevage des moutons et chèvres. Elle est à son 6ème prêt et demande ce dernier pour acheter, élever et vendre des moutons et des chèvres. Elle habite à un village qui est à quelques kilomètres du guichet. Elle n’a pas de parent  bénéficiaire dans l’institution, elle est mariée et mère de famille qui soutient son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes, les frais médicaux et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle rêve d’avoir des bœufs qui viendront de la hollande pour augmenter sa production de lait.
texts.en:
FATIMATA is a Fulani woman who works at selling milk and raising sheep and goats. She is on her 6th loan and is asking for the loan to purchase sheep and goats to raise and sell. She lives in a village a few kilometers from the branch office. She has no relatives who have borrowed from the microfinance institution. 

FATIMATA is a married mother and supports her husband in managing day-to-day expenses, medical costs, and the children’s schooling costs. She has over twenty years of experience. Her day begins at 7 AM and ends at 5 PM. She dreams of having cattle from the Netherlands to increase her milk production.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to raise for milking and selling

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a hardworking man who was born in 1960. He is from the northern part of the country and lives in a rural area. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper.

Ali has been working in agriculture for 15 years so he has a lot of experience. He is an active, brave, well-mannered farmer and agricultural man. Together with his son, he grows wheat, hay and potatoes in their yard. As well as this, he keeps his own well-tended cattle and sells them to the domestic market. He earns 600-700 Somoni from each cow sold. 

Now he needs to buy heating materials to heat his house, and money to cover necessary living expenses, so he is requesting 7,000 Somoni (TJS) of financial support. 

He is also planning to save up money from selling cattle, and next year he wants to improve the conditions for keeping his animals.

He hopes that Kiva lenders will be merciful.

loans.use: To buy heating materials, and to spend on necessary living expenses

loans.name: Mapuni

texts.en:
Mapuni is 70 years old and a married woman with four children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes, sandwiches and noodles in her community, and she has been doing this for three years.

Mapuni has requested a loan to buy plastic cups, cordial, Chinese candy, tinned fish, mayonnaise, bread, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mapuni hopes to increase her business income and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, cordial, Chinese candy, tinned fish, mayonnaise, bread, etc.

loans.name: Sena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sena works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items of ready-to-wear like pants, shorts, t-shirts, shirts, slippers, etc. for her business.

Sena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready-to-wear like pants, shorts, t-shirts, shirts, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Lebina

texts.en:
Lebina is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are currently in school. Lebina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, sanitary pads, coffee, cereals, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Lebina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leevi May

texts.en:
Leevi May works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leevi May would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 57-year-old, married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 39 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by trade and provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Nusrat gives her thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and engine maintenance on her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 45 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lilibeth has a business doing direct selling of Fullerlife products in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products like baby cologne, bath soap, lotion, shampoo, etc. to sell to her customers.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products like baby cologne, bath soap, lotion, shampoo, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maguinda

texts.en:
Maguinda is 29 years old and has five children. Maguinda is married, and four of her children are currently in school.

Maguinda is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Maguinda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maguinda has been in pig fattening for seven years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maguinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 45 years old, and a partner woman with five children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community, and has been doing this for more than four years.

Aiga has requested a loan to buy fishing net, flashlight, goggles, spears, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aiga will pay for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, flashlight, goggles, spears, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, a rake, etc.

loans.name: Maria Aluna

texts.en:
Maria Aluna works hard to support her family. Maria Aluna is widowed, and she has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Maria Aluna requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Aluna has been in this business for five years now.

Maria Aluna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like vinegar, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, diapers, biscuits, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, diapers, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like vinegar, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, diapers, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Perla is 41 years old, and has one child who is currently in school.

Perla has a ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Perla has been in this business for five years. Perla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гульноза, 27 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Гульноза в качестве основного дохода с 2012 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнозы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 0,43 Га земли с кукурузой и картофелем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульноза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и удобрений. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в постройку теплицы, чтобы иметь возможность выращивать экологически чистые овощи.
texts.en: Gulnoza is 27 years old, married, and has three children. As a main source of income, Gulnoza has been raising livestock and growing produce since 2012, having launched this business with the starting amount of 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Gunoza’s hard work, she now has a land plot of 0.43 ha  [1 acre], where she grows corn and potatoes. In order to develop her business further, Gulnoza has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. She plans to invest the revenues from her loan to buy a greenhouse, in order to be able to grow environmentally clean vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow organic vegetables and save for the construction of a hothouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and materials for her brother

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito is 70 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling chips and ice-cakes in her community and has been doing this for four years. 

Fiapito has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, bags of salt, bags of sugar, plastic bags and a new freezer. She joined SPBD in 2008, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiapito will plan to expand her business to become profitable and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bags of salt, bags of sugar, plastic bags and a new freezer.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 21 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year.

Lusia has requested a loanto buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, yeast, plastic bags and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2015, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lusia will use her profits to expand her business to become a canteen and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, yeast, plastic bags and cooking oil.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, Es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida y ser un buen profesional.
Quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos, es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de útiles escolares, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas,
texts.en:
Armando is from the city of Curuguaty and is studying accounting. He is a person who is striving to be someone in life and be a good professional.

He wants to help other people through his knowledge and this is why he does his best.

He is asking for a loan so he can cover his school supplies costs, and in this way can continue with his studies and strive to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for college.

loans.name: Sharleen

texts.en:
Sharleen is a 23-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. 

Sharleen has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profits. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

Teresa has been in this business for 38 years. She earns additional income from a food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities, through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Asmani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Asmani, one of Ruma's agents. He joined Ruma a year ago. Asmani lives in Cilegon, located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city. Right now, he is still a student in a university near the place where he lives. 

He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to manage a business. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he has learned how to improve his business. He feels that he can make a good contribution to his community through his small business as well. 

As the business grows, Asmani needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Asmani improve his business and in turn, his community, which needs access to such services. 

In the photo, Asmani is the one who is standing. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services to his community

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is 38 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells ie lavalava (traditional Polynesian garment) to earn a living and has been doing this for more than three years. Miriama has requested a loan to buy material, paint, paint brush, design rubber, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, paint, paint brush, design rubber, etc

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is a 52-year-old woman who is divorced with three children. She runs a business of sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Aliitasi has requested a loan to buy fabric, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.en:
Jumaboi is a businessman. He was born in 1984. He is living in a village. He is a hard-working, active, brave, and helpful person. He tries to be useful for his family and for society, too. He is married. He has one child. The standard of his living is bad. 

Jumaboi's activity is planting agricultural products, also potatoes and wheat. This year he planted potatoes in 0.50 hectare and wheat in 1.0 hectare of his land. 

Jumaboi also keeps, buys, and sells livestock in a domestic market. He has five honored cattle and ten small cattle. He is planning to buy additional small cattle and sell them at retail. From the profit gained, he is planning to improve his standard of living. 

Jumaboi is asking for financial support to buy small cattle and improve his standard of living. He is very pleased with the support from Kiva members.

loans.use: to buy small cattle and improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is 48 years old and a widow with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as flour, sugar, rice, and chicken legs. She has been doing this for more than three years. Miriama needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, chicken legs, sugar, rice, and flour. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business in the future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, chicken legs, mutton flaps, and rice.

loans.name: Tafaota

texts.en: Tafaota is 20 years old with two children. She owns and operates a small business selling ice cake in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Tafaota has requested a loan to buy ice, sugar, a Coolio, plastic bags, and containers to help run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. Tafaota joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy ice, sugar, a Coolio, plastic bags, and containers

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is a hardworking man. He was born in 1977. He lives in a rural area. He has a big family. He is married and has four children. His children are small and he must feed them. It is hard for him to cover all of the family's expenses for everyday items. Their standard of living is bad. 

Bakhtiyor is an experienced man. From early childhood he was taught to keep livestock and to plant potatoes. Bakhtiyor likes his business activity. He is goal oriented, responsible, and an honest person. His wife and children help him with his business. 

He is planning to get a loan to buy eight small cattle. This year he planted potatoes and 0.40 hectare in wheat. He is hoping to make his loan payments from his harvest gains. He is requesting financial support from Kiva and wishes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy eight small cattle

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.en:
Zhamila is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1978. She lives in a small town. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an emigrant. Zhamila is a responsible, honest, kind and cheerful person. She tries to be helpful to society and her family, too. 

Zhamila is a teacher. Pupils are satisfied in her classes; they try not to miss her classes. What she earns from teaching students is not enough for living expenditures so she decided to open her new own business. She wants to buy goods for her grocery store. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS. Zhamila is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell at her grocery store.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, canned goods, meat, and vegetables for her food-vending business.

Flor has been in this business for 10 years. Flor earns additional income from food vending.
