She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, canned goods, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lory works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  

Lory is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lory has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Estelita works hard to support her family. She has a business selling soft drinks in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a cafeteria and a pig-fattening businesses. Estelita is borrowing 35,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more case of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance her husband's blanket making business with the purchase of wool.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Benjie is 18 years old and is the youngest of five children in the family. His sister Vivian, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her tailoring business in the Philippines.

Benjie is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Secondary Education and is currently in his second year of this four-year course. Vivian is borrowing 8,000 PHP to pay for her brother Benjie's tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

When he graduates, Benjie plans to be gainfully employed so he can help to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Fia

texts.en:
Fia is a 63-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business, selling fish in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Fia has requested a loan to buy a canoe, ice bags, fishing nets, containers and fishing gear to assist her with the business. She will use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. 

Fia became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy a canoe, ice bags, fishing nets, containers and fishing gear.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 52 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, buns, doughnuts, etc. in her community and has been doing this for four years. Lina has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lina will use it to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 42 years old and married with six children, two currently in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, and coffee. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina is a 52-year-old mother of nine children. She owns and runs a small business providing transportation services to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Sosefina has requested a loan to pay for new tires, windows, car seats, licensing and air conditioning. She hopes to use the profit to buy another taxi to keep on providing good service. Sosefina became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, windows, car seats, licensing and air conditioning

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 24-year-old mother, with one child. To earn a living, she owns and operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village. 

Rosa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future, using her profit. 

Rosa joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar,a  bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 58 years old and married with three children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Mercy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana, de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada, su pareja tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas, tiene dos hijos adolescentes y actualmente viven en casa alquilada desde hace cinco años.

Rossana, desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a trabajar en casa, con el propósito de ayudarle a su esposo para aportar un poco para los gastos de la casa, ella lava y plancha en varios lugares.- En la mañana hace limpieza y lava las sabanas de un hotel del centro de su municipio y en la tarde va a varios hogares a planchar, el horario es de lunes a domingo.

El préstamo lo utilizará para pagar una deuda en un banco.

El sueño de Rossana es, tener una mini-tienda en su hogar y así cuidar más de sus hijos y siempre con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y pagar a tiempo sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rossanna, aged 36, studied up to ninth grade. She is married and has two teenage children. Her husband has a bicycle repair shop. They have been living in a rented house for five years.

Rossana has been a homemaker for many years. To help her husband out with the household expenses, she does the laundry and ironing for various places. In the mornings, she does the cleaning and washes the sheets for a hotel in her municipality's downtown, and in the afternoons, she goes to different homes to do the ironing. She works from Monday to Sunday.

She will use the loan to pay off a debt that she owns to a bank.

Rossana's dream is to run a small grocery store from her home. This way, she will be able to better care for her children.

She is committed to improve her living conditions and make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay off a debt that she owns to a bank.

loans.name: Phares

texts.en:
"Kenyans are generally small-scale farmers who cannot afford to follow industrialized conventional production. What they do have is access to land and manpower,” Phares says. What they are missing, she says, is the know-how to create a productive farm. “The biggest aspect that is missing in this sector is information.” 

Phares is a a very honest, hardworking, and dedicated farmer who is 66 years of age and lives in Chuka, Kenya, an area known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Phares has so much experience in farming, which she has been doing for ten years. She is considered one of the best farmers in her village. Phares’s primary sources of income are selling maize, milk and eggs and crop farming. 

She is a very dedicated dairy farmer, and she has nicknamed her cow “Gakenia” (cool cow). Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. Although Phares makes profits through selling milk, she is faced with the problem of feeding her cow. She is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. With the loan, her cows will not reject any part of the food, hence increasing milk production and Phares's income level. All that Phares waits for is the lenders' goodwill and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 45 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Sol works very hard to provide for them.

Sol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of goods to sell.

Sol has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Sol would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as Rexine, zippers, and buckles for sewing purses and bags.

loans.name: Faatafa

texts.en: Faatafa is a 25-year-old divorced woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables like beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Faatafa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, wires, seeds, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Faatafa hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wires, chemicals, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Tuamafa

texts.en:
Tuamafa is 25 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business, selling chicken buns in her community, and has been doing this for one year. 

Tuamafa has requested a loan to buy bags of chicken, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuamafa will develop another profitable business better than the previous one and support her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of chicken, bags of flour, yeast and cooking oil.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is a 50-year-old woman partner, with six children. She has a small plantation and she grows vegetables, like beans, tomatoes, and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Toafa has requested a loan to buy wires, chemicals, seeds, a wheelbarrow, rakes, etc. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. 

With her profits, Toafa hopes to improve her business and to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy wires, chemicals, seeds, a  wheelbarrow, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. 

Marilyn is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other items for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other items for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 41 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Virgilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virgilia has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Virgilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers through her dry goods business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance her husband's blanket making business with the purchase of more wool.

loans.name: Faimanifo

texts.en:
Faimanifo is 60 years old and is a widow with seven children. She runs a small business, selling donuts, pancakes, chicken buns, ice-cakes, etc., in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Faimanifo has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, boxes of chicken, cooking oil, bags of salt, plastic bags, and other items for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faimanifo will plan to expand her business and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, boxes of chicken, cooking oil, bags of salt, plastic bags, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, and tools

loans.name: Zhara

texts.en:
Zhara is 23 years old. She owns and operates a small business, selling elei (traditional decorative) printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Zhara has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei design, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Agosto.
En este lugar vive la señora Aurora, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, profesionales y casados.  Su esposo es ebanista y viven en una casa que alquilan.
Doña Aurora con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, también vende ropa por catálogo y esto lo realiza todos los días por tres i cuatro horas, sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta de lunes a sábados,  le gustan estas actividades y lo que más vende son blusas.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, materiales para la costura y ropa por catálogos. Tiene seis años en el Grupo De Crédito lo que le gusta por la facilidad de los pagos con un interés bajo. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
In the Andrés De Vera parish of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the members of the 4 De Agosto village bank meet every fifteen days.

Aurora lives in this place. She is 35, married and from this relationship they have two children, of age, professionals and married. Her husband is a cabinetmaker and they liven in a house that they rent.

Aurora, with the goal of obtaining her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge of cutting and sewing, put a small sewing workshop in her house. There she works sewing all types of clothing for women, men and children. She works based on orders from individuals. She also sells clothing by catalog and she does this every day for three or for hours. She carries out her sales door to door from Monday to Saturday. She likes these activities and what she sells most are blouses.

She is going to use this new loan to buy fabric, materials for sewing and clothing from catalogs. She has been in the village bank for six years and she likes it because of its ease of payments with a low interest. Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a warehouse in the city center.

loans.use: comprar telas, materiales para costura y ropa

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Melva works hard to support her family.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Melva is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melva has been sustaining her business activities with her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of saving enough money to expand her business, and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mergeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mergeline works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mergeline is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell in her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mergeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Sincerlita

texts.en:
Sincerlita is a 54-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sincerlita has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Sincerlita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fiapule

texts.en: Fiapule is a 53-year-old woman who has a partner and four children. She runs a business painting clothes for her community. She has three years experience with this business. Fiapule has requested a loan to buy materials, brushes, boards, paint, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, brushes, paint board. etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Soli

texts.en:
"Soli is 42 years old, and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling biscuits, buns, pancakes, etc. in her community, and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Soli has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, bags of sugar, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Soli will extend her business."

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 44 years old and married with two school-age children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Crispina is a hardworking mother and helps her husband through the income from her flower garden. She earns 3,000 PHP monthly.

She joined Paglaum MPC because she wants to expand her business and earn more. As of now, she applied for a loan of 3,500 PHP to buy additional varieties of flowers and fertilizer.

She dreams that someday she can own a flower farm.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of flowers and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 54 years old. Two of her children are currently in school.

Rebecca has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rebecca has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalita is 47 years old. She has one child currently in school.

Rosalita has business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Rosalita has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers and selling rice grains. Joyce is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 58 years old, and married, with six children.

Helen is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Melita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy food and ingredients such as meat, flour, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Melita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and ingredients such as meat, flour, spices, etc.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of transportation and seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist her husband in paying the repair costs for his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Hinano

texts.en:
Hinano is a 23-year-old mother with one child. She operates a small business, selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Hinano has requested a loan to buy sacks of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan and wooden spoons to assist her with the business. She will use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs. 

Hinano joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy sacks of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan and wooden spoons.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a 50-year-old mother with three children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this over a year. Julie has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Julie hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like eggs, noodles, bread, cooking oil, cereals, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, bread, cooking oil, cereals, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc.

Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like eggs, noodles, bread, cooking oil, cereals, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Atsarina

texts.en:
Atsarina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing netting for her fishing business.

Atsarina has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.ru: Рита 27 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей дошкольного возраста. В 2003 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 6 лошадей и 10 овец. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет до 8,000 сом (KGS). Рита обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади, овец и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Рите улучшить ее благосостояние, развить бизнес и отремонтировать сараи.
texts.en: Rita is 27 and married with three preschool-aged children. She started a business raising livestock in 2003 and now has one cow, six horses and 10 sheep on her farm, with a total monthly income of about 8,000 KGS. She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase a horse and sheep as well as livestock feed. Profits from the loan will allow Rita to improve her quality of life, to develop her business and to renovate her barn.

loans.use: to buy a horse, additional sheep and livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Inom

texts.en: Inom is a businessman. He is a farmer. He was born in 1995. He is living in a rural area. He is married. His wife is a housekeeper. Inom is a hardworking and goal-oriented man. Their family is poor. He was taught from childhood to keep and feed livestock and plant potatoes. Inom is requesting financial support of a 600 somoni loan to buy medicines for his wife. His wife is sick now. She needs some treatment medicines. He planted 0.30 hectares of potatoes and 0.70 hectares of wheat and hopes to make payment from the harvest gained. He is hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his wife.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
An enthusiastic farmer, for many years Felix has cultivated his rice field in Mahayag, enjoying good earnings from his yields. Recently, he requested a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides to ensure the health and yield of his land this cropping season. 

In the future, Felix hopes to buy a truck to transport his crop to market.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Gina Marlene

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 18, 16 y 13 años de edad, dos estudian en colegio y el mayor en universidad. El marido es guardia de seguridad. 
Doña Gina es un gran madre y esposa que  para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y  la educación de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon, Belcorp y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas)  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale tres días por semana y el resto de la semana vende en su casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene más de 8 años  que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un local para vender ropa y todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "4 de Agosto" communal bank meet in the parish of Andrés de Vera, in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí and has been known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees."
 
In this place lives Gina. She is 39 years old, is married, and has three children—aged 18, 16, and 13. Two of her children go to high school, and the eldest attends university. Her husband works as a security guard.

Gina is a great mother and wife. To help her husband with their children's education and household expenses, she generates her own income by selling clothing, shoes, and Avon, Belcorp and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells her products from door to door three days a week and from home the rest of the week. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every weekend. She has been in this business for over eight years, and it is through this occupation that she earns her own income for the benefit of her family. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics, among other products. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for more than two years, and she likes it because the repayments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her clothing and all of her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and the like.

loans.name: Sionie

texts.en:
Thirty-three years old and married, Sionie lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For two years now, she has operated a sari-sari store and rented out a karaoke unit to her customers who want to relax and have fun. 

A member of PMPC for three years, Sionie has requested a loan to buy another karaoke set to attract more customers and earn more sales. In the future, she hopes to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy another Karaoke set

loans.name: Iyus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Iyus. He has already been with Ruma for almost a year. Iyus lives in Sukabumi, located about two hours and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives with his wife and his daughter. His wife is a full-time housewife and mother.

Iyus owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services to his community. He learned about Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. 

As the business starts to run, Iyus is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. It is important to know that your loan will be very useful to help Iyus improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

In the photo, Iyus is shown sitting in his small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 44-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Irene has a fruit-and-vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Irene has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, metal, a porcelain toilet bowl, etc., to build a bathroom with a flushable toilet.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal mujeres unidas está conformada por diez mujeres madres solteras con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de Sta. Rosa del Peñón lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, luchadoras, para salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar  y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir  adelante la coordinadora es Nancy y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, shores, faldas, vestidos, ropa de niño, ropa interior, toallas.etc. Ella dedica a sus negocios unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Y aprovechar la temporada de la entrada de clases de niños jóvenes, a los colegios y universidades, para mejorar sus ventas,  y sus clientelas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra  de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mujeres Unidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" ["United Women"] communal bank is made up of ten women, single mothers who are responsible for twenty children. They are natives of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a place located in the western zone. These women are known for being hardworking and determined to make a living for their little children. Unfortunately, because of the lack of financial resources, they weren't able to study and found themselves needing to go to work to help with household expenses. Now, they are striving to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Nancy is the coordinator, and her economic activity is the sale of new clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, children's clothes, underwear, towels, etc. She works in her business some ten hours a day, offering her products for sale, in order to take advantage of the start of classes for young people and children, in schools and universities, and to improve her sales and her clientele.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying merchandise so that, in the near future, she can earn a better income. Mujeres Unidas is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people of limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of new clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, jeans, children's clothing, sleepwear, and underwear.

loans.name: Selah Marie

texts.en:
Selah Marie is managing her eatery business in Molave. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. She has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering orders for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Mercedes Aidee

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Virgen De La Merced se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora  Mercedes, tiene 53 años, está casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia local.
Doña Mercedes con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes escolares. Trabaja todos los días ocho horas diarias y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The group El Grupo De Crédito Virgen De La Merced meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city renown for its beautiful beaches that are visited at any time of the year, for its food and culture, and for being a city unmatched in beauty with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 53 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is a merchant. She learned tailoring and dressmaking several years ago at a local academy. 

Mrs. Mercedes, with the object of obtaining her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge of tailoring and dressmaking, created in her house a small sewing business. There she makes a living sewing all types of clothing for women, men, and children. Her business is based in orders from particular people as well as making school uniforms in certain seasons. She works every day for 8 hours and at times more when she has orders to be delivered.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other materials for sewing. Her dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia makes good earnings with her farming activities in Tangub. This is how she supports her husband in sustaining their family, enabling her to send all her children to school.

Virginia wants to increase her farm yield especially given that she will have a high cost of living when her children enter college. Virginia approached Paglaum to loan an amount to pay for a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and to b of herbicides, pesticides and fertilizer for more produce. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and to buy herbicides, pesticides and fertilizer for more produce.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Daisy works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Daisy successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Lona Grace

texts.en:
Lona Grace is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. Six of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lona Grace has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lona Grace has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines.

Rose has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood to sell.

She has been selling firewood and charcoal for five years now and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Remedios is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman but has no children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passers by. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality.

With the KES 20,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of kids clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of  kids clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hamsin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Hamsin, who lives in Cilegon, located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city. A Ruma agent for the past year, Hamsin owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services to his community. He feels that he makes a real contribution to Cilegon through his small business.  

As his enterprise grows, Hamsin is requesting a loan from Kiva to provide more mobile payment services for his community, which needs access to such services. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her son's burger shop.

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en: Aniva is 47 years old and a divorced woman with six children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for five years. Aniva has requested a loan to buy fish net, goggles, a flashlight, spears, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aniva hopes to build a new house and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, goggles, spears, torches, etc.

loans.name: Rexie

texts.en:
Rexie is from Sandugan, Larena, Siqujor in the Philippines. She and her husband have a livestock business. They raise native chickens for sale, either dressed or live; they also buy live native chickens from neighborhoods.

Recently, Rexie requested a loan to purchase nails, sticks and hog wire to build an additional chicken cage that has wider space for her chickens. Rexie deeply wishes to sell more dressed and live native chickens each week, to save enough money for future emergencies. She hopes to become a supplier of native chickens in town and in neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase nails, sticks and hog wire to build an additional chicken cage

loans.name: Reynaldo Jr.

texts.en: Reynaldo Jr. wants to fulfill his dreams by completing a degree. He religiously pays attention to making good marks, every semester he enters. For another school year, Reynaldo Jr. is in need of an amount to pay for his school fees. Reynaldo Jr. has big dreams to help his older sister, who is his only family, and his companion in life--this is the reason why he works hard for his education.

loans.use: to pay for his college school fees

loans.name: Gabriel Ramerick

texts.en:
Gabriel Ramerick is 28 years old and married. He lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur.

For the past two years, Gabriel Ramerick has been a farmer. He earns 60,000 PHP quarterly and has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. He is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer.

In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Merlincita

texts.en: Merlincita is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, candies, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

Milagros requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock feed and groceries to resell

loans.name: Bemar

texts.en:
Bemar is 39 years old. He is known in the Tambulig area for his meat shop. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers.

He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks.

He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority as a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for: when all his financing needs for his retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house.

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC. She will use the loan to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits for retail.

This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits for retail.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potatoes and basic grains). Age 63 years; he is married and has six children. It is clear that Victoriano works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Victoriano is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur and supports her one daughter by building houses from the ground up. She has applied for another whole loan, which she will use to buy building material and paints, and to pay her workers.

She wants her daughter to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paints, and pay her workers.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 62 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Dipolog. This is how she supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 6,000 per month. Recently, Filomena availed a loan to buy paint and building materials. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to buy paint and building materials

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en: In the year 2011, Eduard learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Eduard feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. Eduard wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en: Flaviana has considerable preparations for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Dumingag. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. Flaviana hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is managing her rice farm. She earns a meager income from it that primarily supports their family. At present, Erlinda is receiving a monthly pension from an insurance company. This greatly helped her in pursuing her goals.

She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, walls and ceilings, for which she applied for an amount of PHP 45,000. This loan will be used to buy bags of cement, steel bars, and marine plywood for her house.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Erlinda is very thankful when all her financing needs were supported by PMPC.

She deeply wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family someday.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, steel bars, and marine plywood for her house.

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Sarma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Sarma is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of canned goods, milk, sugar, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sarma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Geruncia

texts.en:
Geruncia is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a natural medicines business.

Geruncia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Geruncia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee). Age 33 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Sergio works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Sergio is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
Erkin is a hardworking man. He was born in 1979, and he lives in a remote area. He is married and has three children. 

Erkin is an active, generous, honest and hardworking person. He worked abroad as an emigrant. He has a dream to buy a cotton processor to serve domestic customers. An average number of people in his village are working with planting and harvesting cotton. That is why he thinks his idea is useful and needed for society. 

He wants to start his business with his brother and friends. They have some money saved, but Erkin needs additional capital to buy a machine for processing cotton. After buying a machine for processing cotton, he will find a place of work and will satisfy the needs of his community. Erkin is asking for financial support to buy a cotton processing machine.

loans.use: to buy a machine for processing cotton.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Andresa was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store and pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business .

NWTF is listing Lucrecia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Francisca requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Francisca has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes es estudiante de la carrera de Instrumentación quirúrgica este año termina sus estudios gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia.
 Él quiere ser un profesional y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus conocimientos.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de tesis, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y poder cumplir su meta.
texts.en: Hermes is a student, who is studying surgical instrumentation.  Thanks to all his hard-work and perseverence, this year he will be finishing his studies.  He wants to be a working professional and help his family through his acquired knowledge.  He is requesting this loan to pay for the costs of completing his thesis and that way achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay the costs of getting his diploma.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 61 years old and a widow, residing at Siquijor, in the Philippines. To make a living, she buys and sells assorted products. She joined PMPC on January 17, 2010 in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative.

Recently, she's accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 as additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of assorted products to sell in the local community. She is focusing on selling fertilizers, ornamentals and vegetables for her expansion.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as fertilizers, ornamentals and vegetables to sell in the local community

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia realized that she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned that she could avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business.

Alicia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Alicia wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: María Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Virgen De La Merced se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la  señora María, tiene 35 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 9  y 6 años, todos estudian en la escuela, su esposo trabaja con ella.
Doña María junto a  su esposo se dedican a la  cría de cerdos en un corral cerca de su  casa,  allí ellos  se dedica 6 horas todos los días para darles alimentos y limpieza del criadero, los cría durante cuatro a seis meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa o  vende por libras en algunas tiendas en la localidad y vecino, Llevan varios años dedicados a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar alimento y medicinas para chanchos. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta  porque  le han ayudado mucho los créditos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y que sus hijos y terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Virgen de la Merced" communal bank meet in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches—which are frequently visited all year round—for its cuisine, for its many tourist attractions, and for being a city of incomparable beauty.

In this place lives María. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three children—aged 11, 9, and 6. All her children go to school, and her husband works with her.

María and her husband make a living raising pigs in a sty close to their home. They work there every day for six hours, feeding the pigs and cleaning the place. They spend four to six months raising them, which is the time it takes to get them ready for sale. After this time, they sell the pigs to the merchants, who arrive at their home, or they sell them by the pound to some stores in and around the area. They have been in this business for many years, and it is through this occupation that they have managed to provide for their family.

María will use this new loan to buy feed and medicine for her pigs. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to see that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Vanessa Alexandra

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, hoteles de primera categoría, clubes, bares, discotecas y centros deportivos para el turista. 
En este lugar vive la señora Vanessa, tiene 34 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene dos niños, uno está en séptimo año básico y la más pequeña de 3 años, su esposo es empleado privado y viven en casa propia.
Doña Vanessa es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos para el hogar (manteles, platos, cucharas, etc.). Trabaja de Lunes a sábados seis horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene algún tiempo que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los zapatos y ropa.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa playera ya que por la temporada tiene buena acogida. Hace un año que es socia y le gusta porque el grupo es muy responsable en sus pagos y su asesor es excelente. Sus sueños es tener un bazar con mucha variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, visited and popular resort in Ecuador.  This is due to its beautiful and welcoming beaches, first class hotels, clubs, bars and sports centers for tourists. This is where Vanessa lives.  She is 34 years old, she is married and has two children with her husband, one is in 7th grade and the younger one is 3 years old.  Her husband works for a private company and they live in their own home.  

Vanessa is a housewife and so to help obtain her own income to help her husband with the family expenses she sells clothes, shoes and household products (tablecloths, dishes, utensils, etc.) She works from Monday to Saturday, 6 hours per day. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every 8 days. She's been working in this business for a while and it is going well. Her bestselling items are shoes and clothes.  

This loan is to buy beach clothes as with the season it is a well-received product. It’s been 1 year that she is a member of the organization and she likes it because the group is very responsible with their payments and their adviser is excellent.  Her dream is to have her own shop with a large variety of products.

loans.use: to buy beach clothes.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en: Magdalina is 47 years old and married. She is a resident of Barangay 2, Tangub, in the Philippines. Magdalina has rented a space in the market where she displays a variety of stocks for resale. She has been in this business for 10 years already, earning a good return and enabling her to support the needs of her family in addition to her husband, especially her children's education. Since she wants to generate more income, she joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance and purchased a variety of stocks for resale at the market. She has now applied for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more variety of stocks for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more of a variety of stocks for resale

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
"Hardworking mother" best describes Editha, 52 years old, residing in Tangub, Philippines. Editha has 5 children and is married to a carpenter. The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family. So, she started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” Editha has been in the business more than five years now. 

She wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would be able to send her youngest son to college. 

In order for Editha to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 20,000 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. 

She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Rene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and she is a married woman with eight children. Five of her children are in school, she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Helen has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Helen has been in this business for five years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Margie has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Margie has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Candida Luz

texts.en:
Candida Luz lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. She is a farmer (corn and beans). Age 53 years; she is unmarried. It is clear that Candida Luz works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Candida Luz is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of one child who is still too young for school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two months, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation, as well as seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es: A sus 27 años de edad Mayra es madre soltera, su hija tiene 4 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Mayra vive en una casa prestada y se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y a trabajar al jornal en la agricultura, Mayra va a  invertir el credito en la comprar de chanchos, de aquí espera mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para comprarse un lotecito y poder sembrar algún producto para asi que sus ingresos le permitan que su hija siga estudiando hasta que llegue a tener un titulo.
texts.en: 27-year-old Mayra is a single mother. Her daughter is 4 years old and is already attending school. Mayra lives in a rented house and makes a living by raising pigs and by working as a day labourer in the area of agriculture. Mayra is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs. By doing this, she hopes to improve her business and continue working in order to buy herself a small plot of land and plant some produce so that she has enough income for her daughter to continue studying and obtain a degree.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. Veronica works very hard to provide for her family.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries for resale.

Veronica has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, diapers, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is a 41-year-old mother with five children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over two years. Miriama has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. Miriama became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a small store in Tambulig, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. 

Lucia wants to increase her inventory. She requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. Lucia hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Mustarambony

texts.en:
Mustarambony was born in 1966. She is the caring mother of three children. 

Mustarambony works hard every day to make a living. She has been busy with a farming business for more than 20 years. She mainly grows vegetables and crops. Mustarambony has additional income from animal husbandry. Her children help her with managing her business. 

Mustarambony and her family live poorly as the main family income is from agriculture. Mustarambony wants to grow new vegetables, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer and to pay for rented workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer and to pay for rented workers.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es el centro financiero y económico de la provincia, además de ser la ciudad más poblada de la provincia y una de las principales ciudades del país, alberga grandes organismos culturales, financieros, administrativos y comerciales. 
Aquí vive la señora Ana María, es divorciada y de esa relación tiene 6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad  e independientes y uno de 15 años que estudia en el colegio, ella  tiene casa propia.
Doña Ana María con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). También es auxiliar de Enfermería, trabaja todos los días, en sus ventas unas cuatro horas diarias y en las noches se dedica a la atención de los enfermos, esto lo viene realizando desde hace siete años y la fundación le dio la oportunidad para emprender con su negocio. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Le gusta la fundación porque apoya a que las mujeres para que se superen, su sueño es aumentar su negocio y poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is the financial and economic center of this province, in addition to the province's most populace city, and one of the principal city of the country. It is also home to major cultural, financial, administrative and commercial entities. 

Ana Maria, who lives here, is divorced and from this relationship, there have been six children, five of whom are independent adults now, plus one who is 15 years old and studies in school. Ana Maria owns her own house.

In order to be able to count on her own income, she sells products from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal catalogs, including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women. She is also a nurse's helper, working every day – four hours daily selling her products, and evenings caring for the sick. She has been doing this for the last seven years and the Foundation is providing her with the opportunity to learn to manage her business. 

The loan will be used to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics to sell. She likes the Foundation because it helps women get ahead. Her dream is to augment her business and establish a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose Antonio tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa familiar en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años contando con experiencia en este sector. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi y para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de la misma ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera Jose Antonio espera tener mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Antoniois is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in their family home. They live in a large community in the urban area of Zaña where most of the people work in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in Chiclayo province which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides transportation services with his motorcycle taxi and has been doing this for three years as he has experience in this neighborhood. He has asked for a loan so he can buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi for repairs and maintenance on it because it is in bad shape. Jose Antonio hopes that this will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi for repairs and maintenance on it.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a tricycle passenger transport business. Emma is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries for resale.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 60 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Conchita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns income from dressmaking.

Conchita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is single and has a food production business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Charlene has been in this business for two years now, and earns additional income from raising and fattening pigs.

In the future, Charlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 45 years old and she lives in the frontier village Haghartsin in Tavush region. This nice lady is engaged in farming and agriculture with great pleasure. She manages her farming simultaneously with her work at a factory. Her farm is not a very rich one, but still it brings income and solves many financial problems of her family. 

Her farm cattle, cows and heifers provide a small assortment of milk, macun (national dairy-product) and also some meat for sale. Naira says that she dreams of having a large and nice orchard, vegetable garden and also a rich farm with a great number of cattle. She is sure that with the help of Kiva lenders, also with her lovely husband and her two sons, she will manage to develop and have a big farm.
