She is requesting a loan to buy several pigs and also fodder for her farm cattle. She says that swine breeding can be a good start for her farm expansion.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Elesa

texts.en:
Elesa is 44 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Elesa works very hard to provide for them.

Elesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc. Elesa has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Elesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is 60 years old and has five children. She is a married woman.

Fidela is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Fidela has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fidela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman and she has six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a business buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 


With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: support her husband in buying artificial jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Kibo Group

texts.en:
Nollascor is in his early 30s and is single with two children, both girls who are still in school. He has been running a butcher shop for two years now. He works from 5am to 8.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nollascor's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to increase stock of cow's meat, to start selling, and to buy a freezer. He has paid back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support, having used the profits to pay school fees, add savings to his bank account, and to cover his household expenses. 

Nollascor will use this loan to buy fish, beef and to put a glass door on his butcher shop. He dreams of being an agent for supplying meat and fish. Nollascor will share this loan with his loan group "KIBO", which consists of two people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and beef, and to put a glass door on his butcher shop.

loans.name: Elbek

texts.en: Elbek is a hardworking man. He was born in 1989. He lives in a remote district. He is married and has one child. This is his second loan. Elbek is a generous, honest, conscientious and kind person. He has a big family and he works hard to feed his family. His parents are also living with him. He graduated secondary school with excellence; unfortunately he could not enter university to get higher education because his family was poor. His father works in agriculture and serves other people’s land. His mother is a housekeeper and seasonally she also works in agriculture. Because of his family's hard times he went to Russia to earn money for a better standard of living for his family. Now he is planning to go again to find a job in Russia. He is asking for financial support to buy a ticket to go to Russia. Elbek is hoping for KIVA project member’s mercy.

loans.use: to buy a ticket to go to Russia to work.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Es una comunidad pequeña en una zona rural, donde se respira paz y tranquilidad, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su vehículo propio (mototaxi), cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito, presta este servicio en los alrededores de Cayaltí. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 40 years old, single, and lives in his family's house in the Cayalti district which is located in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. It is a small community in a rural area where peace and tranquility fill the air. The people work mostly in agriculture and in raising animals.

Gonzalo provides transportation services with his own vehicle (motorcycle taxi) and he has more than three years of experience in this business. He provides this service in and around Cayalti and has very good personal and business references in his district. 

He is asking for a loan so he can make repairs and perform maintenance on his vehicle because it is currently in bad shape. This investment would allow him to provide better service to his passengers which would in turn have a very positive impact on his level of income, allowing him and his family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyuge y su menor hija de 2 años de edad en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de diversas líneas lo que le permite ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de cremas de belleza y cosméticos para incrementar el stock de su negocio aprovechando las campañas que ofrecen estas líneas y de esta manera tener en stock los productos para exhibirlos en una vitrina de su negocio, con esto Maritza espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 27 years old. She lives in her own home made from rustic material with her spouse and her minor 2-year-old daughter in the district of Pucara, The population of Pucara works in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock, and it is located in the Province of Jaen which belongs in the Region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

She makes a living selling beauty products of different lines, which allows her to offer a variety of products to her customers. She has applied for a loan to buy beauty creams and cosmetics to increase the supply of her business, taking advantage of the campaigns offered by these lines and in this way having products in stock in order to show them in a display cabinet of her business. With this Maritza hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her clients with which she will generate greater profits and better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty creams and cosmetics to increase supply of her business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a married woman with five children. She is 62 years old, and four of her children are in school. Jacinta is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for seven years. Jacinta has requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Beaurich

texts.en:
Beaurich works hard to support her family. Beaurich is married and has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines.

Beaurich requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

Beaurich has been in this business for 3 years now.

Beaurich would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic mobile load to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 27 years old and married with one child.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jenepher

texts.en:
Jenepher is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenepher is 37 years old now.

Jenepher has a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines. Jenepher requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional gasoline to sell.

Jenepher has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Jenepher would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline to sell

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Yerevan city with her nice family. She is married, and she has a son and a daughter. Both of them are married and Karine already has four pretty and cheerful grandchildren. Karine graduated Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, specializing as an engineer. For several years she worked in her specialty field in Moscow, then from 1987 until today she has worked at the same Institute from which she graduated many years ago. Here, she works as a lecturer of physics. She describes her job as tens and a very responsible one, and she does it with great care and love. 

Karine says that nowadays, the pedagogical methods greatly need to be combined with new technologies, so she wants to make her lessons more attractive and informative simultaneously with the help of a Kiva loan. She needs a loan as she has decided to buy a net-book and also professional literature to use while preparing the themes for her lectures at the Institute.

loans.use: to buy a net-book and professional literature to use while preparing her lectures at the Institute.

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en: Lowela is a 36-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. Lowela is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Lowela has requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of root crops and rice to sell to customers. In the future, Lowela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of root crops and rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crushed plastic raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is 24 years old. He lives in Tbilisi with his parents, 2 brother and a sister-in-law. Davit's mother and brother are tailors. Davit has a great desire to open a tailors workshop and requested a loan. He already purchased sewing machines and needs money to purchase raw materials. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 500 USD. With the received money he will purchase raw materials and his mother and brother will work in his newly opened workshop. Davit hopes that this family business will be profitable and he wants to expand the business gradually in future and employ more people in his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and open a tailors workshop.

loans.name: Buburaiym

texts.ru: Бубурайым, 33 года, замужем, есть 4 дочери. У Бубурайым среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2001 году. Благодаря упорному труду Бубурайым, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем около 6,500 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, также на участке мерою 1,3 Га собственной поливной земли, она выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Бубурайым является лидером группы "Чын", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на строительство дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Buburaiym is 33 and married with four daughters. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 2001. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a monthly income of about 6,500 KGS. On her farm she has six cows and 1.3 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes and corn both for sale and for her own use. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Buburaiym has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase calves. She is the leader of the Chyn group, which consists of two people as well as herself. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, in order to save toward building a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Rosalba is married,  lives with her husband and two children. She currently works part time as an operator in a manufacturing company. She helps her husband financially and takes care of her family. She has developed a hereditary vision problem that is affecting her on daily life activities since she cannot see from a far distance. Recently she went to have the vision exam in order to have the surgery performed. She is using this loan to pay her eye surgery. Rosalba is in the picture having an eye exam.

loans.use: to pay for her eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh and seasonal vegetable for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Lipine

texts.en:
Lipine is 44 years old with three children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Lipine has requested a loan to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Kasia

texts.en:
Kasia is 43 years old with eight children. She owns and operates a small business of selling ice cakes (snow cones) in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Kasia has requested a loan to buy an ice bag, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags and containers to assist her in running the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. Kasia joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy an ice bag, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags and containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials such as zinc sheeting and timber to make home improvements.

loans.name: Ballivian Group

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de bebé.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘el tejar’ caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas; cientos de comerciante se acomodan lado a lado para ofertar ropa, comida, carnes, frutas, etc., de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Wendy es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, usa gorra, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de cuclillas, la segunda de la derecha, usa suéter gris y gorra). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer, y con su hija que ya estudia en la escuela y le gustar jugar. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por el bien de su familia la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; venta de chamarras para niños, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, taller de soldadura, venta de empanadas, venta de hoja de coca y confección de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de bebé, como; pantalones chalecos, gorros, guantes, zapatos y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante en distintas ferias y mercados de la ciudad. “los papás compran todo para los bebes, todo les gusta, todo quieren…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda especializada en ropa de bebé, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de ropa de bebé por mayor para satisfacer la demanda del mercado por temporada. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wendy solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de bebé y con los beneficios pagar los estudios iniciales de su hija.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young woman, 20 years old, married, she has a six-year-old daughter, and her business is selling baby clothing. She is enterprising, independent, a good mother, responsible, and she works hard. 

She sells in the zone of "El Tejar", known for its informal commerce of all types, hundreds of sellers working side by side offering clothing, food, meats, fruits, etc. It is an area of cold, dry climate, with daylight temperatures ranging from five to fifteen degrees centigrade year around.

Wendy has a dark complexion, long black hair, dark eyes, and short stature. She wears a hat. Her mother tongue is Aymará, spoken at home, and she also knows Spanish, spoken in the community and which she uses to do business. (She's seen in the photo kneeling, second from the right, wearing a grey sweater and a hat.) 

She shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver, and with her daughter who's already in school and who likes to play. They live in a rented house made of bricks, with sheet metal roofing, that has running water, electricity, and sewer system.

Her desire to get ahead for the benefit of her family led her to head a communal bank of people so that they could request a loan and reach their goals. They carry out various commercial activities, such as sales of children's jackets, sales of smoothies, sales of cell phone covers, a soldering workshop, sales of empanadas, sales of coca leaves, and a skirt making business.

She sells baby clothing such as pants, sweaters, hats, gloves, shoes and other items. She works every day, covering various fairs and markets in the city.  "Parents buy everything for their children", she comments, "they like it all, they want it all...". She dreams of having a store specializing in baby clothes. 

Wendy is requesting a loan to buy baby clothing. She wants to buy a variety of baby clothing at wholesale, in order to meet seasonal market demands, keep her clients satisfied and to pay for her daughter's education. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she's been doing this work.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing in order to meet seasonal customer demand

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is married and has four children who all go to school. She has additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market. She has been in this business for 19 years. Jesca has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to build a permanent business location and a house. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Familia Mp Group

texts.es:
El grupo Familia MP está compuesto por personas unidad por el lazo familiar. Olga y Adán son hijos de Doña María Casimira y María Mercedes es su nuera. Todos viven en una comunidad mazahua y se apoyan incondicionalmente ante cualquier situación. En el lugar donde habitan, la mayor parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la ganadería.

Doña Casimira tiene 44 años de edad, está casada desde hace 30 con el señor Irineo quien trabaja como albañil y formaron una familia de 8 hijos, 2 de los cuales aún dependen de ellos y se encuentran estudiando.

Desde hace 5 años, Casimira se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos; aunque durante 20 años crió becerros pero la inversión en alimento era mayor además del peligro por el tamaño de los animales. "Comencé la actividad porque mis hijos eran muy pequeños y yo no podía salir a trabajar, no quería descuidarlos". Ella necesita apoyo económico para comprar 5 borregos más, un poco de alimento, pasto y vitaminas. Muy emocionada Doña Casimira comentó que prefiere los borregos porque son fuertes y crecen muy rápido, en tan sólo seis meses ella obtiene muy buenas ganancias.

En un día cotidiano, Casimira se levanta desde muy temprano para dar pastura y agua a los animales mientras ella se dedica al quehacer de su casa. Ya por la tarde regresa nuevamente con los borregos para sacarlos a pasear y alimentarlos una vez más. Los borregos los adquiere en la misma comunidad y cuando han alcanzado el tamaño y precio adecuados los vende a las personas que se dedican a preparar la tradicional barbacoa. El gran sueño de María Mercedes es que su hijos se realicen profesionalmente aunque también le gustaría hacer algunas remodelaciones a su hogar. 

Casimira y el resto del grupo están muy agradecidos con la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo porque ahora tienen un negocio propio que les ayuda a solventar sus gastos y a buscar una mejor calidad de vida. Adan, Olga y Maria Mercedes también invertirán en borreguitos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio, Doña Casimira es quien viste el mandil morado*
texts.en:
The “Familia MP” group is made up of members from the same family. Olga and Adán are María Casimira’s children; María Mercedes is her daughter-in-law. The family lives in a Mazahua community and everyone supports each other unconditionally in whatever situation. The majority of people in the community here work growing corn and in cattle-raising.

Casimira is 44 years old and has been married to Irineo for 30 years. Irineo works as a builder and together the couple has eight children, two of whom are still dependents and in school.

For five years Casimira has made a living raising and fattening up lambs. For 20 years she had raised calves but the cost of feed was higher and the work was more dangerous given the size of the animals.

“I started this work because my children were very young and I could no longer go out to work. I didn’t want to neglect them,” Casimira says. 

Casimira needs financial support in order to buy five more lambs, plus some food, grass and vitamins. Casimira says excitedly that she prefers working with lambs are they are strong and grow very quickly. In just six months she was able to earn very good profits.

On a typical day, Casimira wakes up very early to graze her animals and give them water. At the same time, she takes care of the household chores. In the afternoon Casimira returns home to take the lambs out for a walk and to feed them again. Casimira buys the lambs in her local area. Once they have reached the right size and value, she sells them to people who prepare traditional barbeque meat. Casimira’s big dream is for her children to have a profession. She would also like to make improvements to her house.

Casimira and the rest of the group are very grateful for this loan opportunity as they now have their own businesses to help them cover their personal costs and can work to enjoy a higher quality of life. 

Adán, Olga and Mercedes will also invest in lambs.

*The photograph was taken in the municipality. Casimira is wearing purple.

loans.use: to buy five more lambs, plus some food, grass and vitamins.

location.town: Trampa Chica, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo tiene 62 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo así como para realizar reparaciones y brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera Evaristo espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que aumentará sus ingresos y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Evaristo is 62 years old. He lives in Pucara, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and raising livestock and located in the Province of Jaen that belongs to the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru. 

He provides transportation services in his own motor taxi, transporting his passengers to zones neighboring his district. He relies on his experience in the business and on regular customers who provide personal and professional referrals to him. He has applied for a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle in order to complete repairs and provide maintenance to his motor taxi since it is currently in poor condition. In this way Evaristo hopes to provide a better service to his customers which will increase his earnings and will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle in order to complete repairs and provide maintenance for his motor taxi.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 28 años de edad, vive con sus padres en casa familiar de material rústico en el distrito Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es muy tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore que es resistente a plagas, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, asegurando una buena producción lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
28-year old Leticia lives with her parents in their simple home located in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in her community is quiet. Most of the local people earn their living from agriculture or raising animals.

Leticia grows a variety of coffee called Catimore which is disease-resistant. She’s been doing this for four years so has experience and very good personal and work references. She also raises and sells animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs etc. 

Leticia plans to use the loan to buy compost and fertilizer for her coffee plants. Then she will be sure of good production resulting in increased sales and a greater income so she can improve her own and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy compost and fertilizer for her coffee plants

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Estela works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Estela is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional unit for her videoke rental business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her videoke rental.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 61 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, cereals, milk, coffee, beers, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, cereals, milk, coffee, beers, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. 

Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, cereals, milk, coffee, beers, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 44 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Marilyn has a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase bundles of used shoes to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used shoes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Antonia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonia has been pig fattening for four years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 53 years old and married, with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like eggs, coffee, canned goods, and groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like eggs, coffee, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is happy to have a chance to cooperate with Kiva and Nor Horizon one more time. She is thankful for her first Kiva loan that greatly developed her fruits and vegetables trading business, which she has been running for 22 years already. Aida works at a rented shop in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She says that over many years of working, she managed to gain many customers thanks to her specific ability to have the sweetest, the freshest and not expensive fruits and vegetables in her shop. She sells a great assortment of citrus fruits, different sort of apples, peppers, cucumber, tomatoes, cabbage and greens. She buys all her shop’s assortment from several selected farmers in nearby villages. These products she manages to sell mostly because of the high quality. Aida arranges her work very cutely and she keeps her workplace always clean and nice, so her shop among many of the others on the same street greatly differs.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she will use for the purchase of a lot of fruits and vegetables with the aim of refreshing her shop’s assortment after winter.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fruits and vegetables with the aim of refreshing her shop’s assortment after winter

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Amada works hard to support her family.

She has a ice cream retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Amada is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream retailing business.

Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream retailing business

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Melchora requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials like shells, nylon threads, wire, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for five years now.

Melchora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like shells, nylon threads, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 48 years old and a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Cecelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel describes his birthplace, the frontier village Khashtarak in Tavush region, as the most beautiful and magical place in the world; here he happily lives with his lovely family. Pavel lives with his retired mother, his wife and elder son; his smallest son is now at the army. As Pavel says the place of his house and the scene that can be seen from the balcony of it, makes him the happiest; the nature and the heaven with its' colors here seem so close to him, as we can see in the photo, that as he says he has great inspiration for working a lot and with pleasure.

Pavel is mainly engaged in farming and agriculture in his village and only once in a year he goes abroad to work in the Russian Federation, with the hope to earn some more money for his family needs. Pavel dreams of a farm bigger and a larger vineyard than he has now. The harvest of his vineyard, perfect and sweet grapes, he sells to the factories that produce wine. On his farm Pavel takes care of pigs, sheep and chickens and he manages to sell his farm’s meat and eggs to his regular customers from the city.

This loan will be great for Pavel as he will manage to enlarge his farm and to buy two bulls and also animal fodder for his farm cattle; this loan can be the first step to his farm enlargement.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and also animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Working on the land is one of the hardest jobs because of the great effort you have to make to progress. However, Richard is a man who never gives up despite the weather or situations that happen. He always manages to meet the requirements of his family.

He gets up very early in the morning to go to his farm where he works. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife. They have been blessed with adorable children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 5 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn.  From Kiva lenders, Richard is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES to grow his horticultural business.Loans to smallholder farmers in Kenya are hard to get and It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Richard access to a loan facility that will help him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With this loan, Richard’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

Your support of this young man could give him an enormous push.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman, 31 years old, lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. At the frontier village Enokavan, Arman runs farming and agriculture operations with the help of his family members. Arman’s father and mother greatly help him in these occupations. His wife is busy with the care of their two children.

Previously, Arman worked at different companies and workshops as a driver. For the last five years he has worked as a contractual military serviceman, which he combines with his farming. He has three cows and 30 chickens on his farm. The sale of his farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd and eggs is his parents’ duty. Arman says that his region is great for farming, and making his farm bigger will mean more income for his big family.

This loan will help Arman to buy several bulls and also fodder for his farm cattle till the spring months.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and also fodder for his farm cattle till the spring months.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a hardworking, mixed-use farmer from Chemamoi village, deep in the South Rift region of Kenya. He lives with his mother and wife on a family-owned, three-acre piece of land. For most of his life he has helped out on the farm and developed hands-on experience. 

He started his own farm projects five years ago and has made a living producing and selling milk and tea from the farm. He also purchased a motorcycle to start a transportation service. 

To generate more income, diversify his business, and spread his risks, Isaiah is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Most rural farmers raise poultry for cultural and subsistence purposes, but Isaiah sees potential for a big business. With an increase in the catering industry, the demand for poultry is getting bigger and bigger. 

With this loan, Isaiah will purchase more poultry birds and make more profit. The additional profit will pay for expensive agricultural inputs. With the expansion of his business, Isaiah is setting up a good foundation to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Umuteramyi Group

texts.fr:
J. Claude  fait partie du groupe Umuteramyi et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 28 ans et est marié à une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 mois à 3 ans. 

Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz, tomate, huile de palme,...)  depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à  son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de tomates,et de riz à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Claude is part of the Umuteramyi group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 years old and married to a saleswoman. Together, they have two children, who are one month and three years old. He has run a small shop selling rice, tomato, palm oil, etc. for 10 years. 

He is on his second loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and rice to resell for a profit. In the coming years, he would like to build a house and see his children educated.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and rice to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Pelucy

texts.en:
Pelucy is a fifty-one-year-old female. She is a widow with three children and she lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Pelucy's main business is poultry farming. She also sells maize brand as additional income. She began the business in order to look after herself and family. She has a dream of educating her children and expanding her business. She faces the challenge of market competition. 

Pelucy wants money to buy bricks and sand for construction.

loans.use: to buy bricks and sand for construction.

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: Elena es una joven de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y su hija tiene 8 años de edad y asiste a la escuela, ella desde hace 6 años atrás se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y a la venta de mas productos de revistas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos ya que comenta que si compra por combos o en oferta a ella le sale algo barato y al momento de venderlos le queda buena ganancia, lo que ella aspira es mejorar su negocio y que su hija siga delante en sus estudios
texts.en: Elena is a young woman of 25 years. She is a single mother and her daughter is 8 years old and attends school. Since 6 years ago she has made a living selling cosmetics and magazines. She is going to invest the money from the loan to buy cosmetics since she says that if she buys products in combos or through special offers she will get them cheaply and when selling them will make a good profit. What she hopes is to better her business and that her daughter will continue in her studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан, 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Дети активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Гулжан на сегодняшний день есть: 3 коровы, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,8 ГА, она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Гулжан является одной из трех участников группы "Чын". Доходы от бизнеса помогут ей развить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Gulzhan is 32 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. The children actively help the mother. Today Gulzhan's farm contains 3 cows. She also owns 0.8 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and corn. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount. Gulzhan is one of the three members of the "Chyn" group. The earnings from the business will help her develop the business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Locice

texts.en:
Locice is a 30-year-old married mother of 3 children from town of Mundri South Sudan. She runs a small business selling onions, cooking oil and beans at a local market. 

Locice is requesting a loan of 1400 SSP to help her increase her inventory and thus satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to increase her food stall's inventory

loans.name: Rancho Viejo Group

texts.en:
The members of Rancho Viejo Group are low-income people who decided to install Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in order to have a basic electricity service at home. Funding is asked for financing those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these people pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.
 
Magdalena, standing first from the right in the picture, is a single 30-year-old woman who lives in an isolated house. The four hours of electrical lighting provided by the SSHS allow Magdalena to prepare the corn pancakes she sells more easily.

loans.use: to pay to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Eva Teresa

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de tortas en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, la joven vive en  casa propia con sus padres, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de repellar las paredes y pintando su casa pero como no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, pintura y pago de mano de obra para poder vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: The young woman with the blurred face is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells sandwiches from her home. With her sales she can support herself. She lives in her own home with her parents. She wants to improve her home by finishing plastering the walls and painting the house but as she doesn't have enough capital she is seeking a loan to buy cement, paint and pay for labor in order to be able to live more comfortably and in cleanliness.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with three children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells vegetables. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 (Ugandan shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, and other vegetables. Her major challenges include transportation and perishability of fruits. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business. 

She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, yuca y plátano, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder tener una buena cosecha y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Israel, 45, owns a house where he lives with his wife and three children. He grows corn, beans, cassava and plantain. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in silos, like the one in the picture, and then sells it to locals.

Israel is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc., in order to guarantee a good harvest and a good income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other members of her family. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonieta ella es casada y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Kutimuy”. The bank is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Antonieta is one of the members. She is 60 years old, married, and has three children. Antonieta works at her business of selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, crèmes, and perfumes. Antonieta works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. She has been in this business for several years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products. She is requesting a loan in order to buy crèmes, lipsticks, and perfumes.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling snacks, selling clothes, managing a grocery store, and managing a bookstore.

Antonieta appreciates those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
Al grupo solidario el Buen Pastor lo integran tres mujeres forjadoras del bienestar de sus familias, es coordinado por la señora Ana que a sus 55 años de edad tiene la motivación de seguir trabajando y demostrar que estando solteras ha podido mantener a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida, es el décimo tercer ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con respecto a sus cuotas de pago, cuenta con una experiencia de seis años en lo que es la comercialización de cosméticos y ropa nueva, los ofrece en las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio y en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en camisas colegiales, pantalón colegial, camisetas blancas, talladores, camisolas, camisolines, calcetas, etc., ya que es una de las temporada que mayor demanda tiene debido a que es el inicio del año escolar, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, por lo que agradece y espera que le sigan dando la oportunidad con los créditos y así seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
A este grupo lo integran dos mujeres trabajadoras, una es la señora Xiomara que tiene la edad de 36 años y se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos AVON y ropa a pobladores de su comunidad y la señora Arlen quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Buen Pastor” (The Good Shepherd) includes three women who are helping to shape the well-being of their families. The group coordinator is Sra. Ana. She is 55 years old and has the motivation to keep working. Ana wants to prove that she can sustain her family and improve their living conditions even though she is single. This is the 13th time that she has requested a loan from ADIM for her business. She has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with respect to her payments. Ana has six years of experience in selling cosmetics and new clothes. She offers her products in the communities near her home and at the municipal market. The loan she is requesting will be invested in school uniform shirts, school uniform trousers, white T-shirts, brassieres, slips, negligees, stockings, and other items. Since this is the start of the school year, there is greater demand. With her previous loans, Ana has been able to increase and diversify the products that she offers. For this reason, she is grateful and hopes to continue having the opportunity to access loans. As a result, she can continue improving her living conditions and those of her family.

This group includes two other hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Xiomara. She is 36 years old and sells Avon cosmetics and clothing to the people in her community. Sra. Arlen buys and sells harvested crops at one of the busiest markets in the capital city. She has been in business for three years.

loans.use: to buy school uniform shirts, school uniform trousers, white T-shirts, brassieres, slips, negligees, stockings, and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. 

She operates a taxi business. She has been involved in this business for six years. Christine's business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs to enable her do poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable her do poultry farming.

loans.name: Dolores Amada

texts.es:
Manta es conocida en el Ecuador por tener uno de los mejores puertos marítimos, posee ventajas comparativas (dada su posición geográfica, biodiversidad, climatología, etc.); en todos estos lugares encontramos muchos restaurantes y diversos sitios esparcimiento. 
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 59 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayor de edad  que tienen sus familias, su esposo es pintor y viven en casa propia.
Doña Dolores con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de zapatos y productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días cinco horas diarias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, a ella le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace muchos años, le ha ido muy bien y tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y zapatos. Sus sueños es tener un gran bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is known in Ecuador for having one of the best seaports. Given its geographical position, biodiversity, and weather, among other characteristics, it has many advantages. There are many restaurants and several recreational sites.

This is the place where Dolores lives. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four children—who are of legal age and have families of their own. Her husband is a painter, and they live in their own home.

With the purpose of generating her own income, Dolores sells shoes and products via catalogues from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal such as beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories. She works five hours every day, going from door to door offering her merchandise. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every week. She loves her occupation, which she has been following for many years now. Her business has gone very well, and she has many customers. The products that she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and shoes. 

Her dream is to set up a big store in her home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and shoes.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, esta es una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las principales actividades que se realizan en el distrito son la agricultura y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. Irma piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ventas y le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and her son in the district of Oyotún. It is a rural area located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. The main activities in this district are agriculture and commerce.

Irma works raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, chickens, chicks, pigs, etc. She has more than 10 years of experience with her business which is located at her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals as well as buying balanced feed to fatten them.

This investment will help her to have more variety and productivity with her animals which will have a lot of influence on her business. Irma plans to increase her stock of animals to be able to Tservice the needs and diverse tastes of her clients in the area. this will be reflected in her level of sales and will generate more income for her which will allow her to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as buying balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a decent hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tyres

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita works hard to support her family. Neonita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Neonita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Neonita has been in this business for three years now.

Neonita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a forty-five-year-old hardworking woman married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Annet is a food vender selling fresh foods such as onions, cassava, green pepper, and others to get income for her family. She dreams of expanding her business, However she is faced with a challenge of market competition. She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, cassava and green peppers to sell. 

The photo was taken during market day.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassava and green peppers to sell.

loans.name: Darie

texts.en:
Darie is 33 years old and married with four children who are all currently in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Darie is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Darie has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 30-year-old married mother of one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram is 35 years old and lives with his family in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and has two school-age daughters. Aram has a vocational education and he graduated from the local college's department of economics and banking. Aram used to work in different companies and n several places trying to earn more money and have better living conditions in his native city. For the last five years he has worked as a salesman for a private company. He manages only this work because he has some health problems. He decided to ask for Kiva lenders’ support to pay for treatments every six months in order to control his health issues.This loan in an amount of 210.000 Armenian drams. He will use the loan to receive physiotherapy to feel better and more active.

loans.use: to receive physiotherapy to feel better and more active

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. Avelina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Avelina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her business.

Avelina has been in this business for 23 years now.

In the future, Avelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 55 years old and a married mother of seven children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nancy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nancy has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Silvia Argentina

texts.es:
Silvia, es casada, vive en una propiedad de su madre junto a su esposo y sus hijos menores de edad, su negocio consiste en vender tortillas y antojitos como atoles, enchiladas, yuca, etc., este oficio lo aprendió cuando apoyaba a su madre a vender, posteriormente formo su hogar y logro fundar su propio negocio.
Comprará yuca, harina, maíz, aceite, plátanos, tomates, etc., tendrá mayor cantidad de materia prima  para elaborar las tortillas y antojitos, espera satisfacer a sus clientes y recuperar su inversión con un mayor margen de ganancias.
El proyecto de la señora Silvia es crecer son su negocio, cancelar sus deudas y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Silvia is married and lives on her mother's property together with her husband and young children. Her business consists of selling tortillas and snacks such as hot corn-based drinks, enchiladas and yucca, etc.  She learned the trade when she would help her mother to sell, and later established her household and then founded her own business.  

She will buy yucca, flour, corn, oil, plantains, tomatoes, etc. and will have a greater quantity of fresh ingredients to make her tortillas and snacks.  She hopes to satisfy her clients and have a greater return on her investment.  Silvia's project is to grow her business, repay her debts, and work with her own financial capital.

loans.use: buy yucca, flour, corn, oil, plantains, tomatoes, etc. and will have a greater quantity of fresh ingredients to make her tortillas and snacks.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is a young woman, 32 years old, from a small village in the Khelvachauri district. She has a six-member family and they don't have any significant income for their existence. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and lives in poverty. The family members get social assistance from the local government. Apart from this, they have a small agricultural activity. In particular, they own a milk cow and they sell cheese at the local market. 
Nani is a very hardworking woman and has a great desire to increase the family income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,300 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a minibus and with the help of her brother, she will start a trading business. She will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and her brother will drive the minibus to resell the purchased products with a price markup from village to village. Nani awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар, 64 года, замужем, есть 6 детей. Анар на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в далеком 1994 году. Благодаря упорному труду Анар, на сегодняшний день у нее есть лошадь, 2 коровы, 30 овец, также она выращивает на собственном участке мерою 0,4 ГА картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Anar is 64 years old, married and has 6 children. Anar is retired and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in a distant 1994. Thanks to Anar's hard work, today she has a horse, 2 cows and 30 sheep. She also grows potatoes on 0.4 hectares of owned land. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves for fattening up and resale. Anar plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru: Алтынай, 40 лет, не замужем, есть сын дошкольного возраста. У Алтынай высшее образование, она на протяжении 16 лет работает старшим преподавателем в медицинском колледже, получая заработную плату в размере приметно 10,300 сом (KGS). Алтынай в этом году решила сделать ремонт в ее квартире, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку краски, цемента, кафеля. Свои доходы Алтынай и дальше планирует вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Altynai is 40 years old, not married and has a preschool-age son. Altynai has a higher education and has been working as a senior teacher at a medical college for 16 years, earning a salary of approximately 10,300 som (KGS). This year Altynai decided to make repairs in her apartment and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy paint, cement and ceramic tile. Altynai plans to continue investing her earnings into improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement and ceramic tile in order to make repairs at home

loans.name: Morena Lisseth

texts.es:
Morena, de 31 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta sexto grado, no continuo sus estudios, debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos; fue por esa razón que decidió trabajar para poder ayudarlos en los gastos, está casada y junto con su esposo tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad.

Morena, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, el cual se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mientras que Morena se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio.- Para llegar a su negocio tiene que viajar en bus 6 kilómetros y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para surtir más su venta de frutas y verduras y comprar 2 terneras, para la producción de leche y así aumentar su hato ganadero, así ella tendrá mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Morena, es darle a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que estudien y comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una vivienda de ladrillo, ya que en la que está viviendo por el momento es la de sus suegros.
texts.en:
31-year old Morena is a housewife with a grade 6 education. She didn’t complete her education as her parents couldn’t afford to keep her in school. She decided to get a job so she could help them financially. She is married and she and her husband have two children aged 4 and 1.

Morena lives with her husband and children. He works in agriculture and also raises animals while she sells fruit and vegetables, a job she’s had for seven years. She travels 6km by bus to get to work. Her work schedule is 6 am to 4 pm every day.

The loan she is seeking from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy more fruit and vegetables and two dairy cows. Then she will be able to sell more milk and increase her herd. She will have a larger income to provide her family with a better standard of living.

Morena’s dream is to provide her children with all that is necessary for their education. She also wishes to buy land so she can build a brick house on it. She currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: buy more fruit and vegetables and two dairy cows

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau is a 41-year-old mechanic who lives in the town outskirts and has been a good client with UGAFODE.  Esau repairs bicycles and sells bicycle spare parts. The previous facility extended to him was helpful in his business operations and led to an increase in his income.

He is now applying for a new loan that will help him to buy more oil, lubricants, springs, head gears and other items that he will sell to meet his customers' demands and also to increase his profit. He is hard working and determined to grow his business, and he thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shutters for the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a hard working married woman. She is very appreciative of the services of UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders for improving her community' businesses and livelihoods. Thanks to the UGAFODE Flexible Housing loan, she has been able to put a roof on her house. 

Mable needs this loan to buy shutters, paint and cement to complete her house. She is grateful that the new house is changing her status in society. She is hard working, innovative and very resilient.

loans.use: to buy shutters, cement and paint to complete her house.

loans.name: Rwabigangura Abamwe 2 Group

texts.en:
Norah is the one with the raised hand. She is married with three children, and she is a resident of Rwabigangura cell, Kebisoni sub-county, Rukungiri district. She sells tomatoes as her major source of income and has done this for over six years.

Norah has been affected by limited capital in her business operation. She joined Rwabigangura Abamwe 2 Group to access financial assistance from UGAFODE to add capital in her business, that is, buying more tomatoes to sell. Since it is her source of income, she is assured of customers.

She took a loan of UGX 500,000, which she hopes will enable her to earn more income and meet all her financial needs. The group has requested for a loan, and members hope to improve their businesses as well as their standards of living using the loan from UGAFODE. 

Members of Rwabigangura Abamwe 2 Group thank UGAFODE for financial support, which has enabled them to sustain their businesses and meet their families’ financial needs.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: No Negotiation Group

texts.en:
No negotiation group, as the name implies is a group that does not negotiate when it comes to working hard. These women -  full of determination and zeal - heard about Thrive and how it helps women in business. They formed their group and joined the Thrive program. 

Sibongile is a member of No negotiation group. She is into the business of selling leather products. She started her business in 2004 with a paltry one hundred and fifty Zimbabwean dollars. She bought a leather sewing machine and employed someone experienced in the tailoring of leather products. Sibongile’s business was faring well until it was affected by a lack of working capital. 

The Thrive lessons that they attended have taught Sibongile how to manage business, working in groups and to save money. With her current loan Sibongile is planning to get more leather to produce a lot of products to sell even in neighboring South Africa.

loans.use: To sell leather goods in South Africa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a news agency

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Shazia's husband fix lathe machine, and for buying some additional cutting tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Gwinyai Madzimai Group

texts.en:
Gwinyai Madzimai is a group of four ladies who live in Crowborough, a suburb of Harare. These ladies are diligent and focused in their businesses.  The group started with four group members and Sylvia as the Treasurer has worked hard in keeping the group united.

Sylvia is a widow aged fifty three years. When her husband passed away, she was left with three school going children. Through her cross-border trading business she managed to pay school fees and provide for the needs of her children. She goes to South Africa to purchase different goods to order. 

Before getting support from Thrive Microfinance, she could not really budget her money well such that most times she misused money. With the business management training she received from Thrive, she has made a positive change in the way she spends. Now she is able to record all her transactions and adhere to a savings plan. 
Currently she received an order to supply gas tanks to a local company, so she is focusing on that. With a Kiva loan of $650, she will fund that transaction and continue to strengthen her business.

loans.use: To buy and supply gas tanks and other equipment.

loans.name: Animal Prints Group

texts.en:
Tapiwa is a member of Animal Prints group. She is a single mother of one school going child. She lives in Budiriro 4, Harare. Tapiwa is into the business of selling place mats, which she sells to different organizations in Harare. 

Tapiwa and her group members joined Thrive in November 2014.They are appreciative of the trainings from Thrive. The group benefited a lot from the business advice they received and they wish to maintain a good relationship with Thrive microfinance. Tapiwa and her group members where availed with a group loan from Thrive. 

The group was given a loan of $1100. Tapiwa is planning to increase the number of place mats she sells as she is facing an increase in demand of her products.

loans.use: To increase her stock of place mats for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: support her son's business by buying scrap goods for him to sell.

loans.name: Dios Me Fortalece Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL DIOS ME FORTALECE ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES DOS HOMBRES Y OCHO MUJERES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL.LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES HEYSELL Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ARTESANIA EN UN LUGAR ESPECIFICO DE LA LOCALIDAD. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS  DIAIRAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRAR ARTESANIA COMO: HOLLAS DE BARRO, TINAJAS, COMALES, FLOREROS, ALCANCILLAS, BISUTERIA, ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. DIOS ME FORTALECE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The group "Dios Me Fortalece" is comprised of ten  members (two men and eight women) who are raising a total of 20 children. They are from Malpaisillo which is located in the western part of the country. They are known for being hard-working, responsible people who are determined to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they were unable to get an education and had to find jobs to help cover household expenses. 

As a result of her hard work, the coordinator of the group is Heysell. She earns her living by selling crafts in her community. She spends eight hours daily at work. Heysell plans to use the loan to buy clay cooking pots and jars, griddles, vases, money boxes, jewelry etc. Then she will be able to earn more money in the not-too-distant future. The group "Dios Me Fortalece" is grateful to Kiva lenders who provide poor people and countries like Nicaragua the opportunity to have dignified work.

loans.use: buy more crafts such as clay cooking pots and jars, griddles, vases, money boxes, jewelry etc.

loans.name: Erlenda

texts.en:
Erlenda is 43 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Erlenda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

Erlenda has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Erlenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Victoria is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase bundles of used shoes to sell.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Ivan

texts.es:
Iván es casado tiene 32 años, la esposa tiene 31 años, tiene 2 hijos con los cuales vive en casa familiar en el barrio la Florida que pertenece a la ciudad de Ibarra provincia de Imbabura.
